text:
Blessed is the person who does not
follow the advice of wicked people,
take the path of sinners,
or join the company of mockers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rather, he delights in the teachings of the Lord
and reflects on his teachings day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is like a tree planted beside streams—
a tree that produces fruit in season
and whose leaves do not wither.
He succeeds in everything he does.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wicked people are not like that.
Instead, they are like husks that the wind blows away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is why wicked people will not be able to stand in the judgment
and sinners will not be able to stand where righteous people gather.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord knows the way of righteous people,
but the way of wicked people will end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do the nations gather together?
Why do their people devise useless plots?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kings take their stands.
Rulers make plans together
against the Lord and against his Messiah  by saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Let’s break apart their chains
and shake off their ropes.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one enthroned in heaven laughs.
The Lord makes fun of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he speaks to them in his anger.
In his burning anger he terrifies them by saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have installed my own king on Zion, my holy mountain.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will announce the Lord’s decree.
He said to me:
“You are my Son.
Today I have become your Father.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ask me, and I will give you the nations as your inheritance
and the ends of the earth as your own possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will break them with an iron scepter.
You will smash them to pieces like pottery.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now, you kings, act wisely.
Be warned, you rulers of the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve the Lord with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kiss the Son, or he will become angry
and you will die on your way
because his anger will burst into flames.
Blessed is everyone who takes refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, look how my enemies have increased!
Many are attacking me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are saying about me,
“Even with God on his side,
he won’t be victorious.” Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, are a shield that surrounds me.
You are my glory.
You hold my head high.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I call aloud to the Lord,
and he answers me from his holy mountain. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lie down and sleep.
I wake up again because the Lord continues to support me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am not afraid of the tens of thousands
who have taken positions against me on all sides.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord!
Save me, O my God!
You have slapped all my enemies in the face.
You have smashed the teeth of wicked people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Victory belongs to the Lord!
May your blessing rest on your people. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness.
You have freed me from my troubles.
Have pity on me, and hear my prayer!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You important people,
how long are you going to insult my honor?
How long are you going to love what is empty
and seek what is a lie? Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Know that the Lord singles out godly people for himself.
The Lord hears me when I call to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble and do not sin.
Think about this on your bed and remain quiet. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Offer the sacrifices of righteousness
by trusting the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are saying, “Who can show us anything good?”
Let the light of your presence shine on us, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You put more joy in my heart
than when their grain and new wine increase.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I fall asleep in peace the moment I lie down
because you alone, O Lord, enable me to live securely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open your ears to my words, O Lord.
Consider my innermost thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pay attention to my cry for help, my king and my God,
because I pray only to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the morning, O Lord, hear my voice.
In the morning I lay my needs in front of you,
and I wait.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness.
Evil will never be your guest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who brag cannot stand in your sight.
You hate all troublemakers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You destroy those who tell lies.
The Lord is disgusted with bloodthirsty and deceitful people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will enter your house because of your great mercy.
Out of reverence for you, I will bow toward your holy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, lead me in your righteousness because of those who spy on me.
Make your way in front of me smooth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nothing in their mouths is truthful.
Destruction comes from their hearts.
Their throats are open graves.
They flatter with their tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Condemn them, O God.
Let their own schemes be their downfall.
Throw them out for their many crimes
because they have rebelled against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But let all who take refuge in you rejoice.
Let them sing with joy forever.
Protect them, and let those who love your name triumph in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You bless righteous people, O Lord.
Like a large shield, you surround them with your favor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, do not punish me in your anger
or discipline me in your rage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have pity on me, O Lord, because I am weak.
Heal me, O Lord, because my bones shake with terror.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul has been deeply shaken with terror.
But you, O Lord, how long … ?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come back, O Lord.
Rescue me.
Save me because of your mercy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
In death, no one remembers you.
In the grave, who praises you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am worn out from my groaning.
My eyes flood my bed every night.
I soak my couch with tears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes blur from grief.
They fail because of my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Get away from me, all you troublemakers,
because the Lord has heard the sound of my crying.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has heard my plea for mercy.
The Lord accepts my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All my enemies will be put to shame and deeply shaken with terror.
In a moment they will retreat and be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, I have taken refuge in you.
Save me, and rescue me from all who are pursuing me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a lion they will tear me to pieces
and drag me off with no one to rescue me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
if I have paid back my friend with evil
or rescued someone who has no reason to attack me—
speaker: Narrator

text:
then let the enemy chase me and catch me.
Let him trample my life into the ground.
Let him lay my honor in the dust. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise in anger, O Lord.
Stand up against the fury of my attackers.
Wake up, my God.
You have already pronounced judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let an assembly of people gather around you.
Take your seat high above them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord judges the people of the world.
Judge me, O Lord,
according to my righteousness,
according to my integrity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the evil within wicked people come to an end,
but make the righteous person secure,
O righteous God who examines thoughts and emotions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My shield is God above,
who saves those whose motives are decent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is a fair judge,
a God who is angered by injustice every day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If a person does not change, God sharpens his sword.
By bending his bow, he makes it ready to shoot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He prepares his deadly weapons
and turns them into flaming arrows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See how that person conceives evil,
is pregnant with harm,
and gives birth to lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He digs a pit and shovels it out.
Then he falls into the hole that he made for others.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His mischief lands back on his own head.
His violence comes down on top of him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to the Lord for his righteousness.
I will make music to praise the name of the Lord Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name throughout the earth! 
Your glory is sung above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the mouths of little children and infants,
you have built a fortress against your opponents
to silence the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I look at your heavens,
the creation of your fingers,
the moon and the stars that you have set in place—
speaker: Narrator

text:
what is a mortal that you remember him
or the Son of Man that you take care of him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made him a little lower than yourself.
You have crowned him with glory and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made him rule what your hands created.
You have put everything under his control:
speaker: Narrator

text: all the sheep and cattle, the wild animals,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the birds, the fish,
whatever swims in the currents of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name throughout the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you thanks, O Lord, with all my heart.
I will tell about all the miracles you have done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will find joy and be glad about you.
I will make music to praise your name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my enemies retreat, they will stumble and die in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have defended my just cause:
You sat down on your throne as a fair judge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You condemned nations.
You destroyed wicked people.
You wiped out their names forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The enemy is finished—in ruins forever.
You have uprooted their cities.
Even the memory of them has faded.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet, the Lord is enthroned forever.
He has set up his throne for judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He alone judges the world with righteousness.
He judges its people fairly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is a stronghold for the oppressed,
a stronghold in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who know your name trust you, O Lord,
because you have never deserted those who seek your help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make music to praise the Lord, who is enthroned in Zion.
Announce to the nations what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who avenges murder has remembered oppressed people.
He has never forgotten their cries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have pity on me, O Lord.
Look at what I suffer because of those who hate me.
You take me away from the gates of death
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that I may recite your praises one by one
in the gates of Zion
and find joy in your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations have sunk into the pit they have made.
Their feet are caught in the net they have hidden to trap others.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is known by the judgment he has carried out.
The wicked person is trapped
by the work of his own hands. Higgaion Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wicked people, all the nations who forget God,
will return to the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Needy people will not always be forgotten.
Nor will the hope of oppressed people be lost forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord.
Do not let mortals gain any power.
Let the nations be judged in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Strike them with terror, O Lord.
Let the nations know that they are only mortal. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you so distant, Lord?
Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked person arrogantly pursues oppressed people.
He will be caught in the schemes that he planned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked person boasts about his selfish desires.
He blesses robbers, but he curses the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turns up his nose and says, “God doesn’t care.”
His every thought concludes, “There is no God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He always seems to succeed.
Your judgments are beyond his understanding.
He spits at all his opponents.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says to himself, “Nothing can shake me.
I’ll never face any trouble.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
His mouth is full of cursing, deception, and oppression.
Trouble and wrongdoing are on the tip of his tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He waits in ambush in the villages.
From his hiding places he kills innocent people.
His eyes are on the lookout for victims.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He lies in his hiding place like a lion in his den.
He hides there to catch oppressed people.
He catches oppressed people when he draws them into his net.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His victims are crushed.
They collapse,
and they fall under the weight of his power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says to himself,
“God has forgotten.
He has hidden his face.
He will never see it!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord!
Lift your hand, O God.
Do not forget oppressed people!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why does the wicked person despise God?
Why does he say to himself, “God doesn’t care”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have seen it; yes, you have taken note of trouble and grief
and placed them under your control.
The victim entrusts himself to you.
You alone have been the helper of orphans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Break the arm of the wicked and evil person.
Punish his wickedness until you find no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is king forever and ever.
The nations have vanished from his land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have heard the desire of oppressed people, O Lord.
You encourage them.
You pay close attention to them
speaker: Narrator

text:
in order to provide justice for orphans and oppressed people
so that no mere mortal will terrify them again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have taken refuge in the Lord.
How can you say to me:
“Flee to your mountain like a bird?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wicked people bend their bows.
They set their arrows against the strings
to shoot in the dark at people whose motives are decent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the foundations of life are undermined,
what can a righteous person do?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is in his holy temple.
The Lord’s throne is in heaven.
His eyes see.
They examine Adam’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord tests righteous people,
but he hates wicked people and the ones who love violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rains down fire and burning sulfur upon wicked people.
He makes them drink from a cup filled with scorching wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is righteous.
He loves a righteous way of life.
Decent people will see his face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help, O Lord.
No godly person is left.
Faithful people have vanished from among Adam’s descendants!
speaker: Narrator

text:
All people speak foolishly.
They speak with flattering lips. They say one thing but mean another.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord cut off every flattering lip
and every bragging tongue
speaker: Narrator

text:
that has said,
“We will overcome with our tongues.
With lips such as ours, who can be our master?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Because oppressed people are robbed and needy people groan,
I will now arise,” says the Lord.
“I will provide safety for those who long for it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The promises of the Lord are pure,
like silver refined in a furnace and purified seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, you will protect them.
You will keep each one safe from those people forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wicked people parade around
when immorality increases among Adam’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, O Lord? Will you forget me forever?
How long will you hide your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long must I make decisions alone
with sorrow in my heart day after day?
How long will my enemy triumph over me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look at me! Answer me, O Lord my God!
Light up my eyes,
or else I will die
speaker: Narrator

text:
and my enemy will say, “I have overpowered him.”
My opponents will rejoice because I have been shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I trust your mercy.
My heart finds joy in your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing to the Lord because he has been good to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Godless fools say in their hearts,
“There is no God.”
They are corrupt.
They do disgusting things.
There is no one who does good things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord looks down from heaven on Adam’s descendants
to see if there is anyone who acts wisely,
if there is anyone who seeks help from God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone has turned away.
Together they have become rotten to the core.
No one, not even one person, does good things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are all those troublemakers,
those who devour my people as if they were devouring food,
so ignorant that they do not call on the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
There they are—panic-stricken
because God is with the person who is righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They put the advice of oppressed people to shame
because the Lord is their refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If only salvation for Israel would come from Zion!
When the Lord restores the fortunes of his people,
Jacob will rejoice.
Israel will be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, who may stay in your tent?
Who may live on your holy mountain?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who walks with integrity,
does what is righteous,
and speaks the truth within his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who does not slander with his tongue,
do evil to a friend,
or bring disgrace on his neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who despises those rejected by God
but honors those who fear the Lord. 
The one who makes a promise and does not break it,
even though he is hurt by it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who does not collect interest on a loan
or take a bribe against an innocent person.
Whoever does these things will never be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Protect me, O God, because I take refuge in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said to the Lord,
“You are my Lord. Without you, I have nothing good.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who lead holy lives on earth
are the noble ones who fill me with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who quickly chase after other gods multiply their sorrows.
I will not pour out their sacrificial offerings of blood
or use my lips to speak their names.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my inheritance and my cup.
You are the one who determines my destiny.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your boundary lines mark out pleasant places for me.
Indeed, my inheritance is something beautiful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise the Lord, who advises me.
My conscience warns me at night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I always keep the Lord in front of me.
When he is by my side, I cannot be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is why my heart is glad and my soul rejoices.
My body rests securely
speaker: Narrator

text:
because you do not abandon my soul to the grave
or allow your holy one to decay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make the path of life known to me.
Complete joy is in your presence.
Pleasures are by your side forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my plea for justice, O Lord.
Pay attention to my cry.
Open your ears to my prayer,
which comes from lips free from deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the verdict of my innocence come directly from you.
Let your eyes observe what is fair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have probed my heart.
You have confronted me at night.
You have tested me like silver,
but you found nothing wrong.
I have determined that my mouth will not sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have avoided cruelty because of your word.
In spite of what others have done,
speaker: Narrator

text:
my steps have remained firmly in your paths.
My feet have not slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have called on you because you answer me, O God.
Turn your ear toward me.
Hear what I have to say.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Reveal your miraculous deeds of mercy,
O Savior of those who find refuge by your side
from those who attack them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guard me as if I were the pupil in your eye.
Hide me in the shadow of your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hide me from wicked people who violently attack me,
from my deadly enemies who surround me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have shut out all feeling.
Their mouths have spoken arrogantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have tracked me down.
They have surrounded me.
They have focused their attention on throwing me to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Each one of them is like a lion eager to tear its prey apart
and like a young lion crouching in hiding places.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord; confront them!
Bring them to their knees!
With your sword rescue my life from wicked people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With your power rescue me from mortals, O Lord,
from mortals who enjoy their inheritance only in this life.
You fill their bellies with your treasure.
Their children are satisfied with it,
and they leave what remains to their children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will see your face when I am declared innocent.
When I wake up, I will be satisfied with seeing you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love you, O Lord, my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my rock and my fortress and my Savior,
my God, my rock in whom I take refuge,
my shield, and the strength of my salvation,
my stronghold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord should be praised.
I called on him, and I was saved from my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ropes of death had become tangled around me.
The torrents of destruction had overwhelmed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ropes of the grave had surrounded me.
The clutches of death had confronted me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I called on the Lord in my distress.
I cried to my God for help.
He heard my voice from his temple,
and my cry for help reached his ears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the earth shook and quaked.
Even the foundations of the mountains trembled.
They shook violently because he was angry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Smoke went up from his nostrils,
and a raging fire came out of his mouth.
Glowing coals flared up from it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spread apart the heavens
and came down with a dark cloud under his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rode on one of the angels  as he flew,
and he soared on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made the darkness his hiding place,
the dark rain clouds his covering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of the brightness in front of him,
those rain clouds passed by with hailstones and lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord thundered in the heavens.
The Most High made his voice heard with hailstones and lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shot his arrows and scattered them.
He flashed streaks of lightning and threw them into confusion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the ocean floor could be seen.
The foundations of the earth were laid bare
at your stern warning, O Lord,
at the blast of the breath from your nostrils.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He reached down from high above and took hold of me.
He pulled me out of the raging water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rescued me from my strong enemy
and from those who hated me,
because they were too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the day when I faced disaster, they confronted me,
but the Lord came to my defense.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought me out to a wide-open place.
He rescued me because he was pleased with me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rewarded me
because of my righteousness,
because my hands are clean.
He paid me back
speaker: Narrator

text:
because I have kept the ways of the Lord
and I have not wickedly turned away from my God,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because all his judgments are in front of me
and I have not turned away from his laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was innocent as far as he was concerned.
I have kept myself from guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord paid me back
because of my righteousness,
because he can see that my hands are clean.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In dealing with faithful people you are faithful,
with innocent people you are innocent,
speaker: Narrator

text:
with pure people you are pure.
In dealing with devious people you are clever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You save humble people,
but you bring down a conceited look.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, you light my lamp.
My God turns my darkness into light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With you I can attack a line of soldiers.
With my God I can break through barricades.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God’s way is perfect!
The promise of the Lord has proven to be true.
He is a shield to all those who take refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is God but the Lord?
Who is a rock except our God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
God arms me with strength
and makes my way perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes my feet like those of a deer
and gives me sure footing on high places.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He trains my hands for battle
so that my arms can bend an archer’s bow of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have given me the shield of your salvation.
Your right hand supports me.
Your gentleness makes me great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make a wide path for me to walk on
so that my feet do not slip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I chased my enemies and caught up with them.
I did not return until I had ended their lives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wounded them so badly that they were unable to get up.
They fell under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You armed me with strength for battle.
You made my opponents bow at my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made my enemies turn their backs to me,
and I destroyed those who hated me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried out for help, but there was no one to save them.
They cried out to the Lord, but he did not answer them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I beat them into a powder as fine as the dust blown by the wind.
I threw them out as though they were dirt on the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You rescued me from my conflicts with the people.
You made me the leader of nations.
A people I did not know will serve me:
speaker: Narrator

text:
As soon as they hear of me, they will obey me.
Foreigners will cringe in front of me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Foreigners will lose heart,
and they will tremble when they come out of their fortifications.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord lives!
Thanks be to my rock!
May God my Savior be honored.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God gives me vengeance!
He brings people under my authority.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He saves me from my enemies.
You lift me up above my opponents.
You rescue me from violent people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is why I will give thanks to you, O Lord, among the nations
and make music to praise your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives great victories to his king.
He shows mercy to his anointed,
to David, and to his descendant  forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens declare the glory of God,
and the sky displays what his hands have made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One day tells a story to the next.
One night shares knowledge with the next
speaker: Narrator

text:
without talking,
without words,
without their voices being heard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet, their sound has gone out into the entire world,
their message to the ends of the earth.
He has set up a tent in the heavens for the sun,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which comes out of its chamber like a bridegroom.
Like a champion, it is eager to run its course.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It rises from one end of the heavens.
It circles around to the other.
Nothing is hidden from its heat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The teachings of the Lord are perfect.
They renew the soul.
The testimony of the Lord is dependable.
It makes gullible people wise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The instructions of the Lord are correct.
They make the heart rejoice.
The command of the Lord is radiant.
It makes the eyes shine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is pure.
It endures forever.
The decisions of the Lord are true.
They are completely fair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are more desirable than gold, even the finest gold.
They are sweeter than honey, even the drippings from a honeycomb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As your servant I am warned by them.
There is a great reward in following them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can notice every mistake?
Forgive my hidden faults.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me from sinning.
Do not let anyone gain control over me.
Then I will be blameless,
and I will be free from any great offense.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the words from my mouth and the thoughts from my heart
be acceptable to you, O Lord, my rock and my defender.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will answer you in times of trouble.
The name of the God of Jacob will protect you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will send you help from his holy place
and support you from Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will remember all your grain offerings
and look with favor on your burnt offerings. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will give you your heart’s desire
and carry out all your plans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We will joyfully sing about your victory.
We will wave our flags in the name of our God.
The Lord will fulfill all your requests.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now I know that the Lord will give victory to his anointed king.
He will answer him from his holy heaven
with mighty deeds of his powerful hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some rely on chariots and others on horses,
but we will boast in the name of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will sink to their knees and fall,
but we will rise and stand firm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give victory to the king, O Lord.
Answer us when we call.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king finds joy in your strength, O Lord.
What great joy he has in your victory!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You gave him his heart’s desire.
You did not refuse the prayer from his lips. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
You welcomed him with the blessings of good things
and set a crown of fine gold on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked you for life.
You gave him a long life, forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of your victory his glory is great.
You place splendor and majesty on him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, you made him a blessing forever.
You made him glad with the joy of your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, the king trusts the Lord,
and through the mercy of the Most High, he will not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hand will discover all your enemies.
Your powerful hand will find all who hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you appear, you will make them burn like a blazing furnace.
The Lord will swallow them up in his anger.
Fire will devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will destroy their children from the earth
and their offspring from among Adam’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Although they scheme and plan evil against you,
they will not succeed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They turn their backs and flee
because you aim your bow at their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord, in your strength.
We will sing and make music to praise your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, my God,
why have you abandoned me?
Why are you so far away from helping me,
so far away from the words of my groaning?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God,
I cry out by day, but you do not answer—
also at night, but I find no rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet, you are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our ancestors trusted you.
They trusted, and you rescued them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried to you and were saved.
They trusted you and were never disappointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet, I am a worm and not a man.
I am scorned by humanity and despised by people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who see me make fun of me.
Insults pour from their mouths.
They shake their heads and say,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Put yourself in the Lord’s hands.
Let the Lord save him!
Let God rescue him since he is pleased with him!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, you are the one who brought me out of the womb,
the one who made me feel safe at my mother’s breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was placed in your care from birth.
From my mother’s womb you have been my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be so far away from me.
Trouble is near, and there is no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many bulls have surrounded me.
Strong bulls from Bashan have encircled me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have opened their mouths to attack me
like ferocious, roaring lions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am poured out like water,
and all my bones are out of joint.
My heart is like wax.
It has melted within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My strength is dried up like pieces of broken pottery.
My tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth.
You lay me down in the dust of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Dogs have surrounded me.
A mob has encircled me.
They have pierced my hands and feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I can count all my bones.
People stare.
They gloat over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They divide my clothes among themselves.
They throw dice for my clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be so far away, O Lord.
Come quickly to help me, O my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue my soul from the sword,
my life from vicious dogs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me from the mouth of the lion
and from the horns of wild oxen. 
You have answered me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will tell my people about your name.
I will praise you within the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who fear the Lord, praise him!
All you descendants of Jacob, glorify him!
Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has not despised or been disgusted
with the plight of the oppressed one.
He has not hidden his face from that person.
The Lord heard when that oppressed person
cried out to him for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My praise comes from you while I am among those assembled for worship.
I will fulfill my vows in the presence of those who fear the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oppressed people will eat until they are full.
Those who look to the Lord will praise him.
May you live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the ends of the earth will remember and return to the Lord.
All the families from all the nations will worship you
speaker: Narrator

text:
because the kingdom belongs to the Lord
and he rules the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All prosperous people on earth will eat and worship.
All those who go down to the dust will kneel in front of him,
even those who are barely alive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There will be descendants who serve him,
a generation that will be told about the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will tell people yet to be born about his righteousness—
that he has finished it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my shepherd.
I am never in need.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes me lie down in green pastures.
He leads me beside peaceful waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He renews my soul.
He guides me along the paths of righteousness
for the sake of his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though I walk through the dark valley of death,
because you are with me, I fear no harm.
Your rod and your staff give me courage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You prepare a banquet for me while my enemies watch.
You anoint my head with oil.
My cup overflows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Certainly, goodness and mercy will stay close to me all the days of my life,
and I will remain in the Lord’s house for days without end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth and everything it contains are the Lord’s.
The world and all who live in it are his.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He laid its foundation on the seas
and set it firmly on the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who may go up the Lord’s mountain?
Who may stand in his holy place?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who has clean hands and a pure heart
and does not long for what is false
or lie when he is under oath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This person will receive a blessing from the Lord
and righteousness from God, his savior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the person who seeks him,
who searches for the face of the God of Jacob. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift your heads, you gates.
Be lifted, you ancient doors,
so that the king of glory may come in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is this king of glory?
The Lord, strong and mighty!
The Lord, heroic in battle!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift your heads, you gates.
Be lifted, you ancient doors,
so that the king of glory may come in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who, then, is this king of glory?
The Lord of Armies is the king of glory! Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: To you, O Lord, I lift my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I trust you, O my God.
Do not let me be put to shame.
Do not let my enemies triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No one who waits for you will ever be put to shame,
but all who are unfaithful will be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make your ways known to me, O Lord,
and teach me your paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lead me in your truth and teach me
because you are God, my savior.
I wait all day long for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember, O Lord, your compassionate and merciful deeds.
They have existed from eternity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not remember the sins of my youth or my rebellious ways.
Remember me, O Lord, in keeping with your mercy and your goodness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is good and decent.
That is why he teaches sinners the way they should live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He leads humble people to do what is right,
and he teaches them his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every path of the Lord is one of mercy and truth
for those who cling to his promise  and written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of your name, O Lord,
remove my guilt, because it is great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who, then, is this person that fears the Lord?
He is the one whom the Lord will teach which path to choose.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will enjoy good things in life,
and his descendants will inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord advises those who fear him.
He reveals to them the intent of his promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are always on the Lord.
He removes my feet from traps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me, and have pity on me.
I am lonely and oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Relieve my troubled heart,
and bring me out of my distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look at my misery and suffering,
and forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See how my enemies have increased in number,
how they have hated me with vicious hatred!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Protect my life, and rescue me!
Do not let me be put to shame.
I have taken refuge in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Integrity and honesty will protect me because I wait for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rescue Israel, O God, from all its troubles!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judge me favorably, O Lord,
because I have walked with integrity
and I have trusted you without wavering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Examine me, O Lord, and test me.
Look closely into my heart and mind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I see your mercy in front of me.
I walk in the light of your truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I did not sit with liars,
and I will not be found among hypocrites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have hated the mob of evildoers
and will not sit with wicked people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will wash my hands in innocence.
I will walk around your altar, O Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that I may loudly sing a hymn of thanksgiving
and tell about all your miracles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I love the house where you live,
the place where your glory dwells.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not sweep away my soul along with hardened sinners
or my life along with bloodthirsty people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evil schemes are in their hands.
Their right hands are full of bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I walk with integrity.
Rescue me, and have pity on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My feet stand on level ground.
I will praise the Lord with the choirs in worship.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my light and my salvation.
Who is there to fear?
The Lord is my life’s fortress.
Who is there to be afraid of?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evildoers closed in on me to tear me to pieces.
My opponents and enemies stumbled and fell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though an army sets up camp against me,
my heart will not be afraid.
Even though a war breaks out against me,
I will still have confidence in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have asked one thing from the Lord.
This I will seek:
to remain in the Lord’s house all the days of my life
in order to gaze at the Lord’s beauty
and to search for an answer in his temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He hides me in his shelter when there is trouble.
He keeps me hidden in his tent.
He sets me high on a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now my head will be raised above my enemies who surround me.
I will offer sacrifices with shouts of joy in his tent.
I will sing and make music to praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, O Lord, when I cry aloud.
Have pity on me, and answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you said,
“Seek my face,”
my heart said to you,
“O Lord, I will seek your face.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not hide your face from me.
Do not angrily turn me away.
You have been my help.
Do not leave me!
Do not abandon me, O God, my savior!
speaker: Narrator

text: Even if my father and mother abandon me, the Lord will take care of me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me your way, O Lord.
Lead me on a level path
because I have enemies who spy on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not surrender me to the will of my opponents.
False witnesses have risen against me.
They breathe out violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I believe that I will see the goodness of the Lord
in this world of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wait with hope for the Lord.
Be strong, and let your heart be courageous.
Yes, wait with hope for the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I call to you.
O my rock, do not turn a deaf ear to me.
If you remain silent,
I will be like those who go into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my prayer for mercy when I call to you for help,
when I lift my hands toward your most holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not drag me away with wicked people,
with troublemakers who speak of peace with their neighbors
but have evil in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pay them back for what they have done,
for their evil deeds.
Pay them back for what their hands have done,
and give them what they deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will tear them down and never build them up again,
because they never consider what he has done
or what his hands have made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thank the Lord!
He has heard my prayer for mercy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my strength and my shield.
My heart trusted him, so I received help.
My heart is triumphant; I give thanks to him with my song.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is the strength of his people
and a fortress for the victory of his Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save your people, and bless those who belong to you.
Be their shepherd, and carry them forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give to the Lord, you heavenly beings.
Give to the Lord glory and power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give to the Lord the glory his name deserves.
Worship the Lord in his holy splendor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord rolls over the water.
The God of glory thunders.
The Lord shouts over raging water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord is powerful.
The voice of the Lord is majestic.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars.
The Lord splinters the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes Lebanon skip along like a calf
and Mount Sirion like a wild ox.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord strikes with flashes of lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord makes the wilderness tremble.
The Lord makes the wilderness of Kadesh tremble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord splits the oaks
and strips the trees of the forests bare.
Everyone in his temple is saying, “Glory!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord sat enthroned over the flood.
The Lord sits enthroned as king forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will give power to his people.
The Lord will bless his people with peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will honor you highly, O Lord,
because you have pulled me out of the pit
and have not let my enemies rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God,
I cried out to you for help,
and you healed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, you brought me up from the grave.
You called me back to life
from among those who had gone into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make music to praise the Lord, you faithful people who belong to him.
Remember his holiness by giving thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His anger lasts only a moment.
His favor lasts a lifetime.
Weeping may last for the night,
but there is a song of joy in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When all was well with me, I said,
“I will never be shaken.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, by your favor you have made my mountain stand firm.
When you hid your face, I was terrified.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will cry out to you, O Lord.
I will plead to the Lord for mercy:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“How will you profit if my blood is shed,
if I go into the pit?
Will the dust of my body give thanks to you?
Will it tell about your truth?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, O Lord, and have pity on me!
O Lord, be my helper!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have changed my sobbing into dancing.
You have removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that my soul  may praise you with music and not be silent.
O Lord my God, I will give thanks to you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have taken refuge in you, O Lord.
Never let me be put to shame.
Save me because of your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn your ear toward me.
Rescue me quickly.
Be a rock of refuge for me,
a strong fortress to save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, you are my rock and my fortress.
For the sake of your name, lead me and guide me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my refuge,
so pull me out of the net that they have secretly laid for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Into your hands I entrust my spirit.
You have rescued me, O Lord, God of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate those who cling to false gods, but I trust the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will rejoice and be glad because of your mercy.
You have seen my misery.
You have known the troubles in my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have not handed me over to the enemy.
You have set my feet in a place where I can move freely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have pity on me, O Lord, because I am in distress.
My eyes, my soul, and my body waste away from grief.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My life is exhausted from sorrow,
my years from groaning.
My strength staggers under the weight of my guilt,
and my bones waste away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have become a disgrace because of all my opponents.
I have become someone dreaded by my friends,
even by my neighbors.
Those who see me on the street run away from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have faded from memory as if I were dead
and have become like a piece of broken pottery.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have heard the whispering of many people—
terror on every side—
while they made plans together against me.
They were plotting to take my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I trust you, O Lord.
I said, “You are my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My future is in your hands.
Rescue me from my enemies, from those who persecute me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Smile on me.
Save me with your mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I have called on you, so do not let me be put to shame.
Let wicked people be put to shame.
Let them be silent in the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their lying lips be speechless,
since they speak against righteous people with arrogance and contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your kindness is so great!
You reserve it for those who fear you.
Adam’s descendants watch
as you show it to those who take refuge in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hide them in the secret place of your presence
from those who scheme against them.
You keep them in a shelter,
safe from quarrelsome tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thank the Lord!
He has shown me the miracle of his mercy
in a city under attack.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I was panic-stricken, I said,
“I have been cut off from your sight.”
But you heard my pleas for mercy when I cried out to you for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Love the Lord, all you godly ones!
The Lord protects faithful people,
but he pays back in full those who act arrogantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be strong, all who wait with hope for the Lord,
and let your heart be courageous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the person whose disobedience is forgiven
and whose sin is pardoned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the person whom the Lord no longer accuses of sin
and who has no deceitful thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I kept silent about my sins,
my bones began to weaken because of my groaning all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Day and night your hand laid heavily on me.
My strength shriveled in the summer heat. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
I made my sins known to you, and I did not cover up my guilt.
I decided to confess them to you, O Lord.
Then you forgave all my sins. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this reason let all godly people pray to you
when you may be found.
Then raging floodwater will not reach them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my hiding place.
You protect me from trouble.
You surround me with joyous songs of salvation. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord says,
“I will instruct you.
I will teach you the way that you should go.
I will advise you as my eyes watch over you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t be stubborn like a horse or mule.
They need a bit and bridle in their mouth to restrain them,
or they will not come near you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many heartaches await wicked people,
but mercy surrounds those who trust the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be glad and find joy in the Lord, you righteous people.
Sing with joy, all whose motives are decent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joyfully sing to the Lord, you righteous people.
Praising the Lord is proper for decent people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks with a lyre to the Lord.
Make music for him on a ten-stringed harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing a new song to him.
Play beautifully and joyfully on stringed instruments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s word is correct,
and everything he does is trustworthy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord loves righteousness and justice.
His mercy fills the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens were made by the Lord’s word
and all the stars by the breath of his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gathers the water in the sea like a dam
and puts the oceans in his storehouses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all the earth fear the Lord.
Let all who live in the world stand in awe of him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and it came into being.
He gave the order, and there it stood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord blocks the plans of the nations.
He frustrates the schemes of the people of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s plan stands firm forever.
His thoughts stand firm in every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord.
Blessed are the people he has chosen as his own.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord looks down from heaven.
He sees all of Adam’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the place where he sits enthroned,
he looks down upon all who live on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who formed their hearts
understands everything they do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No king achieves a victory with a large army.
No warrior rescues himself by his own great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Horses are not a guarantee for victory.
Their great strength cannot help someone escape.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s eyes are on those who fear him,
on those who wait with hope for his mercy
speaker: Narrator

text:
to rescue their souls from death
and keep them alive during a famine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We wait for the Lord.
He is our help and our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In him our hearts find joy.
In his holy name we trust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your mercy rest on us, O Lord,
since we wait with hope for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will thank the Lord at all times.
My mouth will always praise him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul will boast about the Lord.
Those who are oppressed will hear it and rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord’s greatness with me.
Let us highly honor his name together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I went to the Lord for help.
He answered me and rescued me from all my fears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who look to him will be radiant.
Their faces will never be covered with shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Here is a poor man who called out.
The Lord heard him and saved him from all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Messenger of the Lord camps around those who fear him,
and he rescues them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Taste and see that the Lord is good.
Blessed is the person who takes refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fear the Lord, you holy people who belong to him.
Those who fear him are never in need.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Young lions go hungry and may starve,
but those who seek the Lord’s help have all the good things they need.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, children, listen to me.
I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Which of you wants a full life?
Who would like to live long enough to enjoy good things?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep your tongue from saying evil things
and your lips from speaking deceitful things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn away from evil, and do good.
Seek peace, and pursue it!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s eyes are on righteous people.
His ears hear their cry for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord confronts those who do evil
in order to wipe out all memory of them from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteous people cry out.
The Lord hears and rescues them from all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is near to those whose hearts are humble.
He saves those whose spirits are crushed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous person has many troubles,
but the Lord rescues him from all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord guards all of his bones.
Not one of them is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evil will kill wicked people,
and those who hate righteous people will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord protects the souls of his servants.
All who take refuge in him will never be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, attack those who attack me.
Fight against those who fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Use your shields, both small and large.
Arise to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hold your spear to block the way of those who pursue me.
Say to my soul, “I am your savior.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who seek my life be put to shame and disgraced.
Let those who plan my downfall be turned back in confusion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be like husks blown by the wind
as the Messenger of the Lord chases them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their path be dark and slippery
as the Messenger of the Lord pursues them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For no reason they hid their net in a pit.
For no reason they dug the pit to trap me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let destruction surprise them.
Let the net that they hid catch them.
Let them fall into their own pit and be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul will find joy in the Lord
and be joyful about his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All my bones will say, “O Lord, who can compare with you?
You rescue the weak person from the one who is too strong for him
and weak and needy people from the one who robs them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Malicious people bring charges against me.
They ask me things I know nothing about.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am devastated
because they pay me back with evil instead of good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But when they were sick, I wore sackcloth.
I humbled myself with fasting.
When my prayer returned unanswered,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I walked around as if I were mourning for my friend or my brother.
I was bent over as if I were mourning for my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet, when I stumbled,
they rejoiced and gathered together.
They gathered together against me.
Unknown attackers tore me apart without stopping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With crude and abusive mockers,
they grit their teeth at me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, how long will you look on?
Rescue me from their attacks.
Rescue my precious life from the lions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you thanks in a large gathering.
I will praise you in a crowd of worshipers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let my treacherous enemies gloat over me.
Do not let those who hate me for no reason wink at me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They do not talk about peace.
Instead, they scheme against the peaceful people in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They open their big mouths and say about me,
“Aha! Aha! Our own eyes have seen it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have seen it, O Lord.
Do not remain silent.
O Lord, do not be so far away from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up, and rise to my defense.
Plead my case, O my God and my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judge me by your righteousness, O Lord my God.
Do not let them gloat over me
speaker: Narrator

text:
or think, “Aha, just what we wanted!”
Do not let them say, “We have swallowed him up.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who gloat over my downfall
be thoroughly put to shame and confused.
Let those who promote themselves at my expense
be clothed with shame and disgrace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who are happy when I am declared innocent
joyfully sing and rejoice.
Let them continually say, “The Lord is great.
He is happy when his servant has peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then my tongue will tell about your righteousness,
about your praise all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is an inspired truth about the wicked person
who has rebellion in the depths of his heart:
He is not terrified of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He flatters himself and does not hate or even recognize his guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words from his mouth are nothing but trouble and deception.
He has stopped doing what is wise and good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He invents trouble while lying on his bed
and chooses to go the wrong direction.
He does not reject evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, your mercy reaches to the heavens,
your faithfulness to the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your righteousness is like the mountains of God,
your judgments like the deep ocean.
You save people and animals, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your mercy is so precious, O God,
that Adam’s descendants take refuge
in the shadow of your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are refreshed with the rich foods in your house,
and you make them drink from the river of your pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, the fountain of life is with you.
In your light we see light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Continue to show your mercy to those who know you
and your righteousness to those whose motives are decent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let the feet of arrogant people step on me
or the hands of wicked people push me away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look at the troublemakers who have fallen.
They have been pushed down and are unable to stand up again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be preoccupied with evildoers.
Do not envy those who do wicked things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will quickly dry up like grass
and wither away like green plants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trust the Lord, and do good things.
Live in the land, and practice being faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be happy with the Lord,
and he will give you the desires of your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Entrust your ways to the Lord.
Trust him, and he will act on your behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will make your righteousness shine like a light,
your just cause like the noonday sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surrender yourself to the Lord, and wait patiently for him.
Do not be preoccupied with an evildoer who succeeds in his way
when he carries out his schemes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let go of anger, and leave rage behind.
Do not be preoccupied.
It only leads to evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evildoers will be cut off from their inheritance,
but those who wait with hope for the Lord will inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In a little while a wicked person will vanish.
Then you can carefully examine where he was,
but there will be no trace of him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oppressed people will inherit the land
and will enjoy unlimited peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked person plots against a righteous one
and grits his teeth at him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord laughs at him
because he has seen that his time is coming.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wicked people pull out their swords and bend their bows
to kill oppressed and needy people,
to slaughter those who are decent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But their own swords will pierce their hearts,
and their bows will be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The little that the righteous person has is better
than the wealth of many wicked people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The arms of wicked people will be broken,
but the Lord continues to support righteous people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord knows the daily struggles of innocent people.
Their inheritance will last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will not be put to shame in trying times.
Even in times of famine they will be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But wicked people will disappear.
The Lord’s enemies will vanish like the best part of a meadow.
They will vanish like smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked person borrows, but he does not repay.
A righteous person is generous and giving.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who are blessed by him will inherit the land.
Those who are cursed by him will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person’s steps are directed by the Lord,
and the Lord delights in his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he falls, he will not be thrown down headfirst
because the Lord holds on to his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have been young, and now I am old,
but I have never seen a righteous person abandoned
or his descendants begging for food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is always generous and lends freely.
His descendants are a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Avoid evil, do good, and live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord loves justice,
and he will not abandon his godly ones.
They will be kept safe forever,
but the descendants of wicked people will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteous people will inherit the land
and live there permanently.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of the righteous person reflects on wisdom.
His tongue speaks what is fair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The teachings of his God are in his heart.
His feet do not slip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked person watches the righteous person
and seeks to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord will not abandon him to the wicked person’s power
or condemn him when he is brought to trial.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wait with hope for the Lord, and follow his path,
and he will honor you by giving you the land.
When wicked people are cut off, you will see it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen a wicked person acting like a tyrant,
spreading himself out like a large cedar tree.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he moved on, and now there is no trace of him.
I searched for him, but he could not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Notice the innocent person,
and look at the decent person,
because the peacemaker has a future.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But rebels will be completely destroyed.
The future of wicked people will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The victory for righteous people comes from the Lord.
He is their fortress in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord helps them and rescues them.
He rescues them from wicked people.
He saves them because they have taken refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, do not angrily punish me
or discipline me in your wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your arrows have struck me.
Your hand has struck me hard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No healthy spot is left on my body
because of your rage.
There is no peace in my bones
because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My guilt has overwhelmed me.
Like a heavy load, it is more than I can bear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My wounds smell rotten.
They fester because of my stupidity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am bent over and bowed down very low.
All day I walk around in mourning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My insides are filled with burning pain,
and no healthy spot is left on my body.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am numb and completely devastated.
I roar because my heart’s in turmoil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You know all my desires, O Lord,
and my groaning has not been hidden from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is pounding.
I have lost my strength.
Even the light of my eyes has left me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My loved ones and my friends keep their distance
and my relatives stand far away because of my sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who seek my life lay traps for me.
Those who are out to harm me talk about ruining me.
All day long they think of ways to deceive me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am like a person who cannot hear
and like a person who cannot speak.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am like one who cannot hear
and who can offer no arguments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I wait with hope for you, O Lord.
You will answer, O Lord, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “Do not let them gloat over me.
When my foot slips,
do not let them promote themselves at my expense.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am ready to fall.
I am continually aware of my pain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I confess my guilt.
My sin troubles me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mortal enemies are growing stronger.
Many hate me for no reason.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They pay me back with evil instead of good,
and they accuse me because I try to do what is good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not abandon me, O Lord.
O my God, do not be so distant from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come quickly to help me, O Lord, my savior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said,
“I will watch my ways so that I do not sin with my tongue.
I will bridle my mouth while wicked people are in my presence.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remained totally speechless.
I kept silent, although it did me no good.
While I was deep in thought, my pain grew worse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart burned like a fire flaring up within me.
Then I spoke with my tongue:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Teach me, O Lord, about the end of my life.
Teach me about the number of days I have left
so that I may know how temporary my life is.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, you have made the length of my days only a few inches.
My life span is nothing compared to yours.
Certainly, everyone alive is like a whisper in the wind. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Each person who walks around is like a shadow.
They are busy for no reason.
They accumulate riches without knowing who will get them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And now, Lord, what am I waiting for?
My hope is in you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me from all my rebellious acts.
Do not disgrace me in front of godless fools.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remained speechless.
I did not open my mouth
because you are the one who has done this.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove the sickness you laid upon me.
My life is over because you struck me with your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With stern warnings you discipline people for their crimes.
Like a moth you eat away at what is dear to them.
Certainly, everyone is like a whisper in the wind. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my prayer, O Lord.
Open your ear to my cry for help.
Do not be deaf to my tears,
for I am a foreign resident with you,
a stranger like all my ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look away from me so that I may smile again
before I go away and am no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I waited patiently for the Lord.
He turned to me and heard my cry for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He pulled me out of a horrible pit,
out of the mud and clay.
He set my feet on a rock
and made my steps secure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He placed a new song in my mouth,
a song of praise to our God.
Many will see this and worship.
They will trust the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the person
who places his confidence in the Lord
and does not rely on arrogant people
or those who follow lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have done many miraculous things, O Lord my God.
You have made many wonderful plans for us.
No one compares to you!
I will tell others about your miracles,
which are more than I can count.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You were not pleased with sacrifices and offerings.
You have dug out two ears for me.
You did not ask for burnt offerings or sacrifices for sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said, “I have come!
(It is written about me in the scroll of the book.)
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am happy to do your will, O my God.”
Your teachings are deep within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will announce the good news of righteousness
among those assembled for worship.
I will not close my lips.
You know that, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have not buried your righteousness deep in my heart.
I have been outspoken about your faithfulness and your salvation.
I have not hidden your mercy and your truth
from those assembled for worship.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not withhold your compassion from me, O Lord.
May your mercy and your truth always protect me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Countless evils have surrounded me.
My sins have caught up with me so that I can no longer see.
They outnumber the hairs on my head.
I have lost heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, please rescue me!
Come quickly to help me, O Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all those who seek to end my life
be confused and put to shame.
Let those who want my downfall
be turned back and disgraced.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who say to me, “Aha! Aha!”
be stunned by their own shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all who seek you rejoice and be glad because of you.
Let those who love your salvation continually say,
“The Lord is great!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am oppressed and needy.
May the Lord think of me.
You are my help and my savior.
O my God, do not delay!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the one who has concern for helpless people.
The Lord will rescue him in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will protect him and keep him alive.
He will be blessed in the land.
Do not place him at the mercy of his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will support him on his sickbed.
You will restore this person to health when he is ill.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “O Lord, have pity on me!
Heal my soul because I have sinned against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies say terrible things about me:
“When will he die, and when will his family name disappear?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When one of them comes to visit me, he speaks foolishly.
His heart collects gossip.
Then he leaves to tell others.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone who hates me whispers about me.
They think evil things about me and say,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“A devilish disease has attached itself to him.
He will never leave his sickbed.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even my closest friend whom I trusted,
the one who ate my bread,
has lifted his heel against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have pity on me, O Lord!
Raise me up so that I can pay them back
speaker: Narrator

text:
and my enemy cannot shout in triumph over me.
When you do this, I know that you are pleased with me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You defend my integrity,
and you set me in your presence forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thank the Lord God of Israel through all eternity!
Amen and amen!
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a deer longs for flowing streams,
so my soul longs for you, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.
When may I come to see God’s face?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My tears are my food day and night.
People ask me all day long, “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will remember these things as I pour out my soul:
how I used to walk with the crowd
and lead it in a procession to God’s house.
I sang songs of joy and thanksgiving
while crowds of people celebrated a festival.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you discouraged, my soul?
Why are you so restless?
Put your hope in God,
because I will still praise him.
He is my savior and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is discouraged.
That is why I will remember you
in the land of Jordan, on the peaks of Hermon, on Mount Mizar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One deep sea calls to another at the roar of your waterspouts.
All the whitecaps on your waves have swept over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord commands his mercy during the day,
and at night his song is with me—
a prayer to the God of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will ask God, my rock,
“Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I walk around in mourning
while the enemy oppresses me?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
With a shattering blow to my bones,
my enemies taunt me.
They ask me all day long, “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you discouraged, my soul?
Why are you so restless?
Put your hope in God,
because I will still praise him.
He is my savior and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judge me, O God,
and plead my case against an ungodly nation.
Rescue me from deceitful and unjust people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my fortress, O God!
Why have you rejected me?
Why must I walk around in mourning
while the enemy oppresses me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Send your light and your truth.
Let them guide me.
Let them bring me to your holy mountain
and to your dwelling place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then let me go to the altar of God, to God my highest joy,
and I will give thanks to you on the lyre, O God, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you discouraged, my soul?
Why are you so restless?
Put your hope in God,
because I will still praise him.
He is my savior and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God,
we have heard it with our own ears.
Our ancestors have told us
about the miracle you performed in their day,
in days long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By your power you forced nations out of the land,
but you planted our ancestors there.
You shattered many groups of people,
but you set our ancestors free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It was not with their swords that they took possession of the land.
They did not gain victory with their own strength.
It was your right hand, your arm,
and the light of your presence that did it,
because you were pleased with them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You alone are my king, O God.
You won those victories for Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With you we can walk over our enemies.
With your name we can trample those who attack us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I do not rely on my bow,
and my sword will never save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you saved us from our enemies.
You put to shame those who hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long we praise our God.
We give thanks to you forever. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
But now you have rejected and disgraced us.
You do not even go along with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make us retreat from the enemy.
Those who hate us rob us at will.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hand us over to be butchered like sheep
and scatter us among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sell your people for almost nothing,
and at that price you have gained nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made us a disgrace to our neighbors
and an object of ridicule and contempt to those around us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made our defeat a proverb among the nations
so that people shake their heads at us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long my disgrace is in front of me.
Shame covers my face
speaker: Narrator

text:
because of the words of those who insult and slander us,
because of the presence of the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Although all of this happened to us,
we never forgot you.
We never ignored your promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our hearts never turned away.
Our feet never left your path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet, you crushed us in a place for jackals
and covered us with the shadow of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If we forgot the name of our God
or stretched out our hands to pray to another god,
speaker: Narrator

text:
wouldn’t God find out,
since he knows the secrets in our hearts?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, we are being killed all day long because of you.
We are thought of as sheep to be slaughtered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up! Why are you sleeping, O Lord?
Awake! Do not reject us forever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you hide your face?
Why do you forget our suffering and misery?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our souls are bowing in the dust.
Our bodies cling to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise! Help us!
Rescue us because of your mercy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is overflowing with good news.
I will direct my song to the king.
My tongue is a pen for a skillful writer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are the most handsome of Adam’s descendants.
Grace is poured on your lips.
That is why God has blessed you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O warrior, strap your sword to your side
with your splendor and majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ride on victoriously in your majesty
for the cause of truth, humility, and righteousness.
Let your right hand teach you awe-inspiring things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies.
Nations fall beneath you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever.
The scepter in your kingdom is a scepter for justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have loved what is right and hated what is wrong.
That is why God, your God, has anointed you,
rather than your companions, with the oil of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your robes are fragrant with myrrh, aloes, and cassia.
From ivory palaces the music of stringed instruments delights you.
