speaker: Narrator

text:
You, O Lord, are good and forgiving,
full of mercy toward everyone who calls out to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open your ears to my prayer, O Lord.
Pay attention when I plead for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I am in trouble, I call out to you
because you answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No god is like you, O Lord.
No one can do what you do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the nations that you have made
will bow in your presence, O Lord.
They will honor you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, you are great, a worker of miracles.
You alone are God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me your way, O Lord,
so that I may live in your truth.
Focus my heart on fearing you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you with all my heart, O Lord my God.
I will honor you forever
speaker: Narrator

text:
because your mercy toward me is great.
You have rescued me from the depths of hell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, arrogant people attack me,
and a mob of ruthless people seeks my life.
They think nothing of you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, are a compassionate and merciful God.
You are patient, always faithful and ready to forgive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn toward me, and have pity on me.
Give me your strength because I am your servant.
Save me because I am the son of your female servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Grant me some proof of your goodness
so that those who hate me may see it and be put to shame.
You, O Lord, have helped me and comforted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city the Lord has founded stands on holy mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord loves the city of Zion
more than any other place in Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glorious things are said about you, O city of God! Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord says, “I will add Egypt and Babylon
as well as Philistia, Tyre, and Sudan
to the list of those who acknowledge me.
Each nation will claim that it was born there.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But it will be said of Zion,
“Every race is born in it.
The Most High will make it secure.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will record this in the Book of Nations:
“Every race claims that it was born there.” Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Singers and dancers will sing,
“Zion is the source of all our blessings.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord God, my savior,
I cry out to you during the day and at night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my prayer come into your presence.
Turn your ear to hear my cries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is filled with troubles,
and my life comes closer to the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am numbered with those who go into the pit.
I am like a man without any strength—
speaker: Narrator

text:
abandoned with the dead,
like those who have been killed and lie in graves,
like those whom you no longer remember,
who are cut off from your power.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have put me in the bottom of the pit—in deep, dark places.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your rage lies heavily on me.
You make all your waves pound on me. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have taken my friends far away from me.
You made me disgusting to them.
I’m shut in, and I can’t get out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes grow weak because of my suffering.
All day long I call out to you, O Lord.
I stretch out my hands to you in prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will you perform miracles for those who are dead?
Will the spirits of the dead rise and give thanks to you? Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will anyone tell about your mercy in Sheol
or about your faithfulness in Abaddon?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will anyone know about your miracles in that dark place
or about your righteousness in the place where forgotten people live?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry out to you for help, O Lord,
and in the morning my prayer will come into your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you reject my soul, O Lord?
Why do you hide your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ever since I was young, I have been suffering and near death.
I have endured your terrors, and now I am in despair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your burning anger has swept over me.
Your terrors have destroyed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They swirl around me all day long like water.
They surround me on all sides.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have taken my loved ones and friends far away from me.
Darkness is my only friend!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing forever about the evidence of your mercy, O Lord.
I will tell about your faithfulness to every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “Your mercy will last forever.
Your faithfulness stands firm in the heavens.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You said, “I have made a promise  to my chosen one.
I swore this oath to my servant David:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘I will make your dynasty continue forever.
I built your throne to last throughout every generation.’ ” Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, the heavens praise your miracles
and your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who in the skies can compare with the Lord?
Who among the heavenly beings is like the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is terrifying in the council of the holy ones.
He is greater and more awe-inspiring than those who surround him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord God of Armies, who is like you?
Mighty Lord, even your faithfulness surrounds you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You rule the raging sea.
When its waves rise, you quiet them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You crushed Rahab;  it was like a corpse.
With your strong arm you scattered your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens are yours.
The earth is also yours.
You made the world and everything in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You created north and south.
Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon sing your name joyfully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your arm is mighty.
Your hand is strong.
Your right hand is lifted high.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteousness and justice are the foundations of your throne.
Mercy and truth stand in front of you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are the people who know how to praise you.
They walk in the light of your presence, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They find joy in your name all day long.
They are joyful in your righteousness
speaker: Narrator

text:
because you are the glory of their strength.
By your favor you give us victory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our shield belongs to the Lord.
Our king belongs to the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Once in a vision you said to your faithful ones:
“I set a boy above warriors.
I have raised up one chosen from the people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I found my servant David.
I anointed him with my holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My hand is ready to help him.
My arm will also give him strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No enemy will take him by surprise.
No wicked person will mistreat him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will crush his enemies in front of him
and defeat those who hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My faithfulness and mercy will be with him,
and in my name he will be victorious.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will put his left hand on the sea
and his right hand on the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will call out to me,
‘You are my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, I will make him the firstborn.
He will be the Most High to the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mercy will stay with him forever.
My promise to him is unbreakable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make his dynasty endure forever
and his throne like the days of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“If his descendants abandon my teachings
and do not live by my rules,
speaker: Narrator

text:
if they violate my laws
and do not obey my commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text:
then with a rod I will punish their rebellion
and their crimes with beatings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will not take my mercy away from him
or allow my truth to become a lie.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not dishonor my promise
or alter my own agreement.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On my holiness I have taken an oath once and for all:
I will not lie to David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His dynasty will last forever.
His throne will be in my presence like the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like the moon his throne will stand firm forever.
It will be like a faithful witness in heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have despised, rejected,
and become angry with your anointed one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have refused to recognize the promise to your servant
and have thrown his crown into the dirt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have broken through all his walls
and have laid his fortified cities in ruins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
(Everyone who passed by robbed him.
He has become the object of his neighbors’ scorn.)
speaker: Narrator

text:
You held the right hand of his enemies high
and made all of his adversaries rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You even took his sword out of his hand
and failed to support him in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You put an end to his splendor
and hurled his throne to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You cut short the days of his youth
and covered him with shame. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, O Lord? Will you hide yourself forever?
How long will your anger continue to burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember how short my life is!
Have you created Adam’s descendants for no reason?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can a mortal go on living and never see death?
Who can set himself free from the power of the grave? Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where is the evidence of your mercy, Lord?
You swore an oath to David on the basis of your faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember, O Lord, how your servant  has been insulted.
Remember how I have carried in my heart the insults from so many people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your enemies insulted me.
They insulted your Messiah  every step he took.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thank the Lord forever.
Amen and amen!
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, you have been our refuge throughout every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before the mountains were born,
before you gave birth to the earth and the world, you were God.
You are God from everlasting to everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You turn mortals back into dust
and say, “Return, descendants of Adam.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, in your sight a thousand years are like a single day,
like yesterday—already past—
like an hour in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sweep mortals away.
They are a dream.
They sprout again in the morning like cut grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the morning they blossom and sprout.
In the evening they wither and dry up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, your anger consumes us.
Your rage terrifies us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have set our sins in front of you.
You have put our secret sins in the light of your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, all our days slip away because of your fury.
We live out our years like one long sigh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Each of us lives for 70 years—
or even 80 if we are in good health.
But the best of them bring trouble and misery.
Indeed, they are soon gone, and we fly away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who fully understands the power of your anger?
A person fears you more when he better understands your fury.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach us to number each of our days
so that we may grow in wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return, Lord! How long … ?
Change your plans about us, your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Satisfy us every morning with your mercy
so that we may sing joyfully and rejoice all our days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make us rejoice for as many days as you have made us suffer,
for as many years as we have experienced evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let us, your servants, see what you can do.
Let our children see your glorious power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the kindness of the Lord our God be with us.
Make us successful in everything we do.
Yes, make us successful in everything we do.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoever lives under the shelter of the Most High
will remain in the shadow of the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will say to the Lord,
“You are my refuge and my fortress, my God in whom I trust.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who will rescue you from hunters’ traps
and from deadly plagues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will cover you with his feathers,
and under his wings you will find refuge.
His truth is your shield and armor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You do not need to fear
terrors of the night,
arrows that fly during the day,
speaker: Narrator

text:
plagues that roam the dark,
epidemics that strike at noon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will not come near you,
even though a thousand may fall dead beside you
or ten thousand at your right side.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You only have to look with your eyes
to see the punishment of wicked people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, O Lord, are my refuge! 
You have made the Most High your home.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No harm will come to you.
No sickness will come near your house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will put his angels in charge of you
to protect you in all your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will carry you in their hands
so that you never hit your foot against a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will step on lions and cobras.
You will trample young lions and snakes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because you love me, I will rescue you.
I will protect you because you know my name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you call to me, I will answer you.
I will be with you when you are in trouble.
I will save you and honor you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will satisfy you with a long life.
I will show you how I will save you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is good to give thanks to the Lord,
to make music to praise your name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is good to announce your mercy in the morning
and your faithfulness in the evening
speaker: Narrator

text:
on a ten-stringed instrument and a harp
and with a melody on a lyre.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made me find joy in what you have done, O Lord.
I will sing joyfully about the works of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How spectacular are your works, O Lord!
How very deep are your thoughts!
speaker: Narrator

text:
A stupid person cannot know
and a fool cannot understand
speaker: Narrator

text:
that wicked people sprout like grass
and all troublemakers blossom like flowers,
only to be destroyed forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, O Lord, are highly honored forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now look at your enemies, O Lord.
Now look at your enemies.
They disappear, and all troublemakers are scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you make me as strong as a wild bull,
and soothing lotion is poured on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes gloat over those who spy on me.
My ears hear the cries of evildoers attacking me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteous people flourish like palm trees
and grow tall like the cedars in Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are planted in the Lord’s house.
They blossom in our God’s courtyards.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even when they are old, they still bear fruit.
They are always healthy and fresh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They make it known that the Lord is decent.
He is my rock.
He is never unfair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rules as king! He is clothed with majesty.
The Lord has clothed himself; he has armed himself with power.
The world was set in place; it cannot be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your throne was set in place a long time ago.
You are eternal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ocean rises, O Lord.
The ocean rises with a roar.
The ocean rises with its pounding waves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord above is mighty—
mightier than the sound of raging water,
mightier than the foaming waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your written testimonies are completely reliable.
O Lord, holiness is what makes your house beautiful for days without end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, God of vengeance,
O God of vengeance, appear!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Judge of the earth.
Give arrogant people what they deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, O Lord, will wicked people triumph?
How long?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They ramble.
They speak arrogantly.
All troublemakers brag about themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They crush your people, O Lord.
They make those who belong to you suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text: They kill widows and foreigners, and they murder orphans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They say, “The Lord doesn’t see it.
The God of Jacob doesn’t even pay attention to it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pay attention, you stupid people!
When will you become wise, you fools?
speaker: Narrator

text:
God created ears.
Do you think he can’t hear?
He formed eyes.
Do you think he can’t see?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He disciplines nations.
Do you think he can’t punish?
He teaches people.
Do you think he doesn’t know anything?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord knows that people’s thoughts are pointless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, blessed is the person
whom you discipline and instruct from your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You give him peace and quiet from times of trouble
while a pit is dug to trap wicked people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will never desert his people
or abandon those who belong to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The decisions of judges will again become fair,
and everyone whose motives are decent will pursue justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will stand up for me against evildoers?
Who will stand by my side against troublemakers?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If the Lord had not come to help me,
my soul would have quickly fallen silent in death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I said, “My feet are slipping,”
your mercy, O Lord, continued to hold me up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I worried about many things,
your assuring words soothed my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are wicked rulers who use the law to do unlawful things
able to be your partners?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They join forces to take the lives of righteous people.
They condemn innocent people to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has become my stronghold.
My God has become my rock of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has turned their own wickedness against them.
He will destroy them because of their sins.
The Lord our God will destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, let’s sing joyfully to the Lord.
Let’s shout happily to the rock of our salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let’s come into his presence with a song of thanksgiving.
Let’s shout happily to him with psalms.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is a great God and a great king above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In his hand are the deep places of the earth,
and the mountain peaks are his.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea is his.
He made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, let’s worship and bow down.
Let’s kneel in front of the Lord, our maker,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because he is our God
and we are the people in his care,
the flock that he leads. 
If only you would listen to him today!
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not be stubborn like my people were at Meribah,
like the time at Massah in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your ancestors challenged me and tested me there,
although they had seen what I had done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For 40 years I was disgusted with those people.
So I said, ‘They are a people whose hearts continue to stray.
They have not learned my ways.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is why I angrily took this solemn oath:
‘They will never enter my place of rest!’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord a new song!
Sing to the Lord, all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord! Praise his name!
Day after day announce that the Lord saves his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell people about his glory.
Tell all the nations about his miracles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is great!
He should be highly praised.
He should be feared more than all other gods
speaker: Narrator

text:
because all the gods of the nations are idols.
The Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Splendor and majesty are in his presence.
Strength and beauty are in his holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give to the Lord, you families of the nations.
Give to the Lord glory and power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give to the Lord the glory he deserves.
Bring an offering, and come into his courtyards.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Worship the Lord in his holy splendor.
Tremble in his presence, all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say to the nations, “The Lord rules as king!”
The earth stands firm; it cannot be moved.
He will judge people fairly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens rejoice and the earth be glad.
Let the sea and everything in it roar like thunder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the fields and everything in them rejoice.
Then all the trees in the forest will sing joyfully
speaker: Narrator

text:
in the Lord’s presence because he is coming.
He is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness and its people with his truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rules as king.
Let the earth rejoice.
Let all the islands be joyful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Clouds and darkness surround him.
Righteousness and justice are the foundations of his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire spreads ahead of him.
It burns his enemies who surround him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His flashes of lightning light up the world.
The earth sees them and trembles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains melt like wax in the presence of the Lord,
in the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens tell about his righteousness,
and all the people of the world see his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone who worships idols
and brags about false gods will be put to shame.
All the gods will bow to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Zion hears about this and rejoices.
The people of Judah are delighted with your judgments, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, O Lord, the Most High, are above the whole earth.
You are highest. You are above all the gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who love the Lord hate evil.
The one who guards the lives of his godly ones
will rescue them from the power of wicked people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Light dawns for righteous people 
and joy for those whose motives are decent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Find joy in the Lord, you righteous people.
Give thanks to him as you remember how holy he is.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing a new song to the Lord
because he has done miraculous things.
His right hand and his holy arm have gained victory for him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has made his salvation known.
He has uncovered his righteousness for the nations to see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has not forgotten to be merciful and faithful
to Israel’s descendants.
All the ends of the earth have seen how our God saves them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shout happily to the Lord, all the earth.
Break out into joyful singing, and make music.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make music to the Lord with a lyre,
with a lyre and the melody of a psalm,
speaker: Narrator

text:
with trumpets and the playing of a ram’s horn.
Shout happily in the presence of the king, the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea, everything in it,
the world, and those who live in it roar like thunder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the rivers clap their hands
and the mountains sing joyfully
speaker: Narrator

text:
in the Lord’s presence
because he is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with justice
and its people with fairness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rules as king.
Let the people tremble.
He is enthroned over the angels.
Let the earth quake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is mighty in Zion.
He is high above all people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to your great and fearful name. 
He is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king’s strength is that he loves justice.
You have established fairness.
You have done what is fair and right for Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Highly honor the Lord our God.
Bow down at his footstool. 
He is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moses and Aaron were among his priests.
Samuel was among those who prayed to him.
They called to the Lord, and he answered them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke to them from a column of smoke.
They obeyed his written instructions and the laws that he gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, our God, you answered them.
You showed them that you are a forgiving God
and that you are a God who punishes their sinful deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Highly honor the Lord our God.
Bow at his holy mountain. 
The Lord our God is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Shout happily to the Lord, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Serve the Lord cheerfully.
Come into his presence with a joyful song.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Realize that the Lord alone is God.
He made us, and we are his.
We are his people and the sheep in his care.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Enter his gates with a song of thanksgiving.
Come into his courtyards with a song of praise.
Give thanks to him; praise his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is good.
His mercy endures forever.
His faithfulness endures throughout every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing about mercy and justice.
O Lord, I will make music to praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I want to understand the path to integrity.
When will you come to me? 
I will live in my own home with integrity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not put anything wicked in front of my eyes.
I hate what unfaithful people do.
I want no part of it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will keep far away from devious minds.
I will have nothing to do with evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will destroy anyone who secretly slanders his neighbor.
I will not tolerate anyone with a conceited look or arrogant heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes will be watching the faithful people in the land
so that they may live with me.
The person who lives with integrity will serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who does deceitful things will not stay in my home.
The one who tells lies will not remain in my presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every morning I will destroy all the wicked people in the land
to rid the Lord’s city of all troublemakers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, hear my prayer,
and let my cry for help come to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not hide your face from me when I am in trouble.
Turn your ear toward me.
Answer me quickly when I call.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My days disappear like smoke.
My bones burn like hot coals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is beaten down and withered like grass
because I have forgotten about eating.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am nothing but skin and bones
because of my loud groans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am like a desert owl,
like an owl living in the ruins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lie awake.
I am like a lonely bird on a rooftop.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long my enemies insult me.
Those who ridicule me use my name as a curse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I eat ashes like bread
and my tears are mixed with my drink
speaker: Narrator

text:
because of your hostility and anger,
because you have picked me up and thrown me away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My days are like a shadow that is getting longer,
and I wither away like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, remain forever.
You are remembered throughout every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will rise and have compassion on Zion,
because it is time to grant a favor to it.
Indeed, the appointed time has come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your servants value Zion’s stones,
and they pity its rubble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations will fear the Lord’s name.
All the kings of the earth will fear your glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Lord builds Zion,
he will appear in his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will turn his attention to the prayers
of those who have been abandoned.
He will not despise their prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This will be written down for a future generation
so that a people yet to be created may praise the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The Lord looked down from his holy place high above.
From heaven he looked at the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He heard the groans of the prisoners
and set free those who were condemned to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s name is announced in Zion
and his praise in Jerusalem
speaker: Narrator

text:
when nations and kingdoms gather
to worship the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has weakened my strength along the way.
He has reduced the number of my days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “My God, don’t take me now in the middle of my life.
Your years continue on throughout every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth.
Even the heavens are the works of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will come to an end, but you will still go on.
They will all wear out like clothing.
You will change them like clothes,
and they will be thrown away.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you remain the same, and your life will never end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children of your servants will go on living here.
Their descendants will be secure in your presence.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, my soul!
Praise his holy name, all that is within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, my soul,
and never forget all the good he has done:
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who forgives all your sins,
the one who heals all your diseases,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the one who rescues your life from the pit,
the one who crowns you with mercy and compassion,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the one who fills your life with blessings
so that you become young again like an eagle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord does what is right and fair
for all who are oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He let Moses know his ways.
He let the Israelites know the things he had done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is compassionate, merciful, patient,
and always ready to forgive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not always accuse us of wrong
or be angry with us forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has not treated us as we deserve for our sins
or paid us back for our wrongs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As high as the heavens are above the earth—
that is how vast his mercy is toward those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As far as the east is from the west—
that is how far he has removed our rebellious acts from himself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a father has compassion for his children,
so the Lord has compassion for those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He certainly knows what we are made of.
He bears in mind that we are dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Human life is as short-lived as grass.
It blossoms like a flower in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the wind blows over the flower, it disappears,
and there is no longer any sign of it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But from everlasting to everlasting,
the Lord’s mercy is on those who fear him.
His righteousness belongs
to their children and grandchildren,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to those who are faithful to his promise,
to those who remember to follow his guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has set his throne in heaven.
His kingdom rules everything.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all his angels,
you mighty beings who carry out his orders
and are ready to obey his spoken orders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all his armies,
his servants who carry out his will.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all his creatures
in all the places of his empire.
Praise the Lord, my soul!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, my soul!
O Lord my God, you are very great.
You are clothed with splendor and majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You cover yourself with light as though it were a robe.
You stretch out the heavens as though they were curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You lay the beams of your home in the water.
You use the clouds for your chariot.
You move on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make your angels winds
and your servants flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You set the earth on its foundations
so that it can never be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You covered the earth with an ocean as though it were a robe.
Water stood above the mountains
speaker: Narrator

text:
and fled because of your threat.
Water ran away at the sound of your thunder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains rose and the valleys sank
to the place you appointed for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Water cannot cross the boundary you set
and cannot come back to cover the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make water gush from springs into valleys.
It flows between the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every wild animal drinks from them.
Wild donkeys quench their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The birds live by the streams.
They sing among the branches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You water the mountains from your home above.
You fill the earth with the fruits of your labors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make grass grow for cattle
and make vegetables for humans to use
in order to get food from the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make wine to cheer human hearts,
olive oil to make faces shine,
and bread to strengthen human hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s trees, the cedars in Lebanon which he planted,
drink their fill.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Birds build their nests in them.
Storks make their homes in fir trees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The high mountains are for wild goats.
The rocks are a refuge for badgers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He created the moon, which marks the seasons,
and the sun, which knows when to set.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brings darkness, and it is nighttime,
when all the wild animals in the forest come out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The young lions roar for their prey
and seek their food from God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the sun rises,
they gather and lie down in their dens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then people go to do their work,
to do their tasks until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What a large number of things you have made, O Lord!
You made them all by wisdom.
The earth is filled with your creatures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea is so big and wide with countless creatures,
living things both large and small.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ships sail on it,
and Leviathan, which you made, plays in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them look to you to give them their food at the right time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You give it to them, and they gather it up.
You open your hand, and they are filled with blessings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hide your face, and they are terrified.
You take away their breath, and they die and return to dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You send out your Spirit, and they are created.
You renew the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the glory of the Lord endure forever.
May the Lord find joy in what he has made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He looks at the earth, and it trembles.
He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to the Lord throughout my life.
I will make music to praise my God as long as I live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my thoughts be pleasing to him.
I will find joy in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May sinners vanish from the world.
May there no longer be any wicked people.
Praise the Lord, my soul! 
Hallelujah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord.
Call on him.
Make known among the nations what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him.
Make music to praise him.
Meditate on all the miracles he has performed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Brag about his holy name.
Let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Search for the Lord and his strength.
Always seek his presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember the miracles he performed,
the amazing things he did, and the judgments he pronounced,
speaker: Narrator

text:
you descendants of his servant Abraham,
you descendants of Jacob, his chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God.
His judgments are pronounced throughout the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He always remembers his promise,
the word that he commanded for a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the promise that he made to Abraham,
and his sworn oath to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He confirmed it as a law for Jacob,
as an everlasting promise to Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
by saying, “I will give you the land of Canaan.
It is your share of the inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
While the people of Israel were few in number,
a small group of foreigners living in that land,
speaker: Narrator

text:
they wandered from nation to nation,
from one kingdom to another.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He didn’t permit anyone to oppress them.
He warned kings about them:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not touch my anointed ones
or harm my prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought famine to the land.
He took away their food supply.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent a man ahead of them.
He sent Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They hurt his feet with shackles,
and cut into his neck with an iron collar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord’s promise tested him through fiery trials
until his prediction came true.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king sent someone to release him.
The ruler of nations set him free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made Joseph the master of his palace
and the ruler of all his possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joseph trained the king’s officers the way he wanted
and taught his respected leaders wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Israel came to Egypt.
Jacob lived as a foreigner in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord made his people grow rapidly in number
and stronger than their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He changed their minds so that they hated his people,
and they dealt treacherously with his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent his servant Moses, and he sent Aaron, whom he had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They displayed his miraculous signs among them
and did amazing things in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent darkness and made their land dark.
They did not rebel against his orders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned their water into blood
and caused their fish to die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made their land swarm with frogs,
even in the kings’ bedrooms.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and swarms of flies and gnats
infested their whole territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them hail and lightning
instead of rain throughout their land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck their grapevines and fig trees
and smashed the trees in their territory.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke, and countless locusts and grasshoppers came.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They devoured all the plants in the land.
They devoured the crops in the fields.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He killed all the firstborn sons,
the first ones born in the land when their fathers were young.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought Israel out with silver and gold,
and no one among his tribes stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Egyptians were terrified of Israel,
so they were glad when Israel left.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spread out a cloud as a protective covering
and a fire to light up the night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Israelites asked, and he brought them quail
and filled them with bread from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He opened a rock, and water gushed
and flowed like a river through the dry places.
speaker: Narrator

text: He remembered his holy promise to his servant Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought his people out with joy,
his chosen ones with a song of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them the lands of other nations,
and they inherited what others had worked for
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that they would obey his laws
and follow his teachings. 
Hallelujah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hallelujah! 
Give thanks to the Lord because he is good,
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can speak about all the mighty things the Lord has done?
Who can announce all the things for which he is worthy of praise?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those who defend justice
and do what is right at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember me, O Lord, when you show favor to your people.
Come to help me with your salvation
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that I may see the prosperity of your chosen ones,
find joy in our people’s happiness,
and brag with the people who belong to you.
