speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the gate of the Lord
through which righteous people will enter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I give thanks to you,
because you have answered me.
You are my savior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The stone that the builders rejected
has become the cornerstone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is responsible for this,
and it is amazing for us to see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the day the Lord has made.
Let’s rejoice and be glad today!
speaker: Narrator

text:
We beg you, O Lord, save us!
We beg you, O Lord, give us success!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
We bless you from the Lord’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is God, and he has given us light.
March in a festival procession
with branches to the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my God, and I give thanks to you.
My God, I honor you highly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord because he is good,
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those whose lives have integrity,
those who follow the teachings of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those who obey his written instructions.
They wholeheartedly search for him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They do nothing wrong.
They follow his directions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have commanded
that your guiding principles be carefully followed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pray that my ways may become firmly established
so that I can obey your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will never feel ashamed
when I study all your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you
as I learn your regulations, which are based on your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will obey your laws.
Never abandon me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can a young person keep his life pure?
He can do it by holding on to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wholeheartedly searched for you.
Do not let me wander away from your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have treasured your promise in my heart
so that I may not sin against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thanks be to you, O Lord.
Teach me your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my lips I have repeated
every regulation that comes from your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I find joy in the way shown by your written instructions
more than I find joy in all kinds of riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I want to reflect on your guiding principles
and study your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your laws make me happy.
I never forget your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be kind to me so that I may live
and hold on to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Uncover my eyes
so that I may see the miraculous things in your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a foreigner in this world.
Do not hide your commandments from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is overwhelmed with endless longing for your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You threaten arrogant people, who are condemned
and wander away from your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove the insults and contempt that have fallen on me
because I have obeyed your written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though influential people plot against me,
I reflect on your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, your written instructions make me happy.
They are my best friends.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am close to death.
Give me a new life as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I told you what I have done, and you answered me.
Teach me your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me understand your guiding principles
so that I may reflect on your miracles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am drowning in tears.
Strengthen me as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn me away from a life of lies.
Graciously provide me with your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have chosen a life of faithfulness.
I have set your regulations in front of me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have clung tightly to your written instructions.
O Lord, do not let me be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will eagerly pursue your commandments
because you continue to increase my understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me, O Lord, how to live by your laws,
and I will obey them to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me understand so that I can follow your teachings.
I will guard them with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lead me on the path of your commandments,
because I am happy with them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Direct my heart toward your written instructions
rather than getting rich in underhanded ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn my eyes away from worthless things.
Give me a new life in your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep your promise to me
so that I can fear you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away insults, which I dread,
because your regulations are good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I long for your guiding principles.
Give me a new life in your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your blessings reach me, O Lord.
Save me as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will have an answer for the one who insults me
since I trust your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not take so much as a single word of truth from my mouth.
My hope is based on your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will follow your teachings forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will walk around freely
because I sought out your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will speak about your written instructions in the presence of kings
and not feel ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your commandments, which I love, make me happy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lift my hands in prayer because of your commandments,
which I love.
I will reflect on your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember the word you gave me.
Through it you gave me hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is my comfort in my misery:
Your promise gave me a new life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arrogant people have mocked me with cruelty,
yet I have not turned away from your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remembered your regulations from long ago, O Lord,
and I found comfort in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am burning with anger because of wicked people,
who abandon your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your laws have become like psalms to me
in this place where I am only a foreigner.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At night I remember your name, O Lord,
and I follow your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This has happened to me
because I have obeyed your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my inheritance, O Lord.
I promised to hold on to your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With all my heart I want to win your favor.
Be kind to me as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have thought about my life,
and I have directed my feet back to your written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Without any hesitation I hurry to obey your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though the ropes of wicked people are tied around me,
I never forget your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At midnight I wake up to give thanks to you
for the regulations, which are based on your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a friend to everyone who fears you
and to everyone who follows your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your mercy, O Lord, fills the earth.
Teach me your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have treated me well, O Lord,
as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me to use good judgment and knowledge,
because I believe in your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before you made me suffer, I used to wander off,
but now I hold on to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are good, and you do good things.
Teach me your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arrogant people have smeared me with lies,
yet I obey your guiding principles with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their hearts are cold and insensitive,
yet I am happy with your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It was good that I had to suffer
in order to learn your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The teachings that come from your mouth are worth more to me
than thousands in gold or silver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hands created me and made me what I am.
Help me understand so that I may learn your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who fear you will see me and rejoice,
because my hope is based on your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know that your regulations are fair, O Lord,
and that you were right to make me suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your mercy comfort me
as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your compassion reach me so that I may live,
because your teachings make me happy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let arrogant people be put to shame
because they lied about me,
yet I reflect on your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who fear you turn to me
so that they can come to know your written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my heart be filled with integrity in regard to your laws
so that I will not be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is weak from waiting for you to save me.
My hope is based on your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes have become strained from looking for your promise.
I ask, “When will you comfort me?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Although I have become like a shriveled and dried out wineskin,
I have not forgotten your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What is left of my life?
When will you bring those who persecute me to justice?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arrogant people have dug pits to trap me
in defiance of your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
(All your commandments are reliable.)
Those people persecute me with lies. Help me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They almost wiped me off the face of the earth.
But I did not abandon your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me a new life through your mercy
so that I may obey the written instructions,
which came from your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, your word is established in heaven forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your faithfulness endures throughout every generation.
You set the earth in place, and it continues to stand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All things continue to stand today because of your regulations,
since they are all your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If your teachings had not made me happy,
then I would have died in my misery.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will never forget your guiding principles,
because you gave me a new life through them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am yours.
Save me, because I have searched for your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked people have waited for me in order to destroy me,
yet I want to understand your written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen a limit to everything else,
but your commandments have no limit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, how I love your teachings!
They are in my thoughts all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
because your commandments are always with me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have more insight than all my teachers,
because your written instructions are in my thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have more wisdom than those with many years of experience,
because I have obeyed your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have kept my feet from walking on any evil path
in order to obey your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have not neglected your regulations,
because you have taught me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How sweet the taste of your promise is!
It tastes sweeter than honey.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From your guiding principles I gain understanding.
That is why I hate every path that leads to lying.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is a lamp for my feet
and a light for my path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I took an oath, and I will keep it.
I took an oath to follow your regulations,
which are based on your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have suffered so much.
Give me a new life, O Lord, as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Please accept the praise I gladly give you, O Lord,
and teach me your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I always take my life into my own hands,
but I never forget your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wicked people have set a trap for me,
but I have never wandered away from your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your written instructions are mine forever.
They are the joy of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have decided to obey your laws.
They offer a reward that never ends.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate two-faced people,
but I love your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my hiding place and my shield.
My hope is based on your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Get away from me, you evildoers,
so that I can obey the commandments of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me God, as you promised, so that I may live.
Do not turn my hope into disappointment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hold me, and I will be safe,
and I will always respect your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You reject all who wander away from your laws,
because their lies mislead them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You get rid of all wicked people on earth as if they were rubbish.
That is why I love your written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My body shudders in fear of you,
and I am afraid of your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have done what is fair and right.
Do not leave me at the mercy of those who oppress me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guarantee my well-being.
Do not let arrogant people oppress me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are strained from looking for you to save me
and from looking for the fulfillment of your righteous promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Treat me with kindness,
and teach me your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am your servant.
Help me understand
so that I may come to know your written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is time for you to act, O Lord.
Even though people have abolished your teachings,
speaker: Narrator

text: I love your commandments more than gold, more than pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I follow the straight paths of your guiding principles.
I hate every pathway that leads to lying.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your written instructions are miraculous.
That is why I obey them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is a doorway that lets in light,
and it helps gullible people understand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I open my mouth and pant
because I long for your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn toward me, and have pity on me
as you have pledged to do for those who love your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make my steps secure through your promise,
and do not let any sin control me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me from human oppression
so that I may obey your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Smile on me,
and teach me your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Streams of tears flow from my eyes
because others do not follow your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are righteous, O Lord,
and your regulations are fair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have issued your written instructions.
They are fair and completely dependable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My devotion for your words consumes me,
because my enemies have forgotten your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your promise has been thoroughly tested,
and I love it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am unimportant and despised,
yet I never forget your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
and your teachings are reliable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trouble and hardship have found me,
but your commandments still make me happy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your written instructions are always right.
Help me understand them so that I will live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have called out with all my heart. Answer me, O Lord.
I want to obey your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have called out.
Save me, so that I can obey your written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I got up before dawn, and I cried out for help.
My hope is based on your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are wide-open throughout the nighttime hours
to reflect on your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In keeping with your mercy, hear my voice.
O Lord, give me a new life guided by your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who carry out plots against me are near,
yet they are far away from your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are near, O Lord,
and all your commandments are reliable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Long ago I learned from your written instructions
that you made them to last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look at my misery, and rescue me,
because I have never forgotten your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Plead my case for me, and save me.
Give me a new life as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wicked people are far from being saved,
because they have not searched for your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your acts of compassion are many in number, O Lord.
Give me a new life guided by your regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have many persecutors and opponents,
yet I have not turned away from your written instructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen traitors,
and I am filled with disgust.
They have not accepted your promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See how I have loved your guiding principles!
O Lord, in keeping with your mercy, give me a new life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is nothing but truth in your word,
and all of your righteous regulations endure forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Influential people have persecuted me for no reason,
but it is only your words that fill my heart with terror.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I find joy in your promise
like someone who finds a priceless treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate lying; I am disgusted with it.
I love your teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seven times a day I praise you
for your righteous regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is lasting peace for those who love your teachings.
Nothing can make those people stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have waited with hope for you to save me, O Lord.
I have carried out your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have obeyed your written instructions.
I have loved them very much.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have followed your guiding principles and your written instructions,
because my whole life is in front of you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my cry for help come into your presence, O Lord.
Help me understand as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my plea for mercy come into your presence.
Rescue me as you promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my lips pour out praise
because you teach me your laws.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my tongue sing about your promise
because all your commandments are fair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your hand help me
because I have chosen to follow your guiding principles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have longed for you to save me, O Lord,
and your teachings make me happy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my soul have new life so that it can praise you.
Let your regulations help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have wandered away like a lost lamb.
Search for me,
because I have never forgotten your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I was in trouble, I cried out to the Lord,
and he answered me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, rescue me from lying lips
and from a deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You deceitful tongue, what can the Lord give you?
What more can he do for you?
speaker: Narrator

text: He will give you a warrior’s sharpened arrows and red-hot coals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How horrible it is to live as a foreigner in Meshech
or to stay in the tents of Kedar.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have lived too long with those who hate peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am for peace, but when I talk about it,
they only talk about war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look up toward the mountains.
Where can I find help?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My help comes from the Lord,
the maker of heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not let you fall.
Your guardian will not fall asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, the Guardian of Israel never rests or sleeps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is your guardian.
The Lord is the shade over your right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun will not beat down on you during the day,
nor will the moon at night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord guards you from every evil.
He guards your life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord guards you as you come and go,
now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was glad when they said to me,
“Let’s go to the house of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Our feet are standing inside your gates, Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jerusalem is built to be a city
where the people are united.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All of the Lord’s tribes go to that city
because it is a law in Israel
to give thanks to the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The court of justice sits there.
It consists of princes who are David’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
“May those who love you prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May there be peace inside your walls
and prosperity in your palaces.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of my relatives and friends, let me say,
“May it go well for you!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of the house of the Lord our God,
I will seek what is good for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look up to you,
to the one who sits enthroned in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As servants depend on their masters,
as a maid depends on her mistress,
so we depend on the Lord our God
until he has pity on us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have pity on us, O Lord.
Have pity on us
because we have suffered more than our share of contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have suffered more than our share of ridicule
from those who are carefree.
We have suffered more than our share of contempt
from those who are arrogant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“If the Lord had not been on our side …”
(Israel should repeat this.)
speaker: Narrator

text: “If the Lord had not been on our side when people attacked us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
then they would have swallowed us alive
when their anger exploded against us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the floodwaters would have swept us away.
An overflowing stream would have washed us away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then raging water would have washed us away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thank the Lord, who did not let them sink their teeth into us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We escaped like a bird caught in a hunter’s trap.
The trap was broken, and we escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our help is in the name of the Lord, the maker of heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who trust the Lord are like Mount Zion,
which can never be shaken.
It remains firm forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
so the Lord surrounds his people now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked ruler will not be allowed to govern
the land set aside for righteous people.
That is why righteous people do not use their power to do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do good, O Lord, to those who are good,
to those whose motives are decent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But when people become crooked,
the Lord will lead them away with troublemakers. 
Let there be peace in Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Lord restored the fortunes of Zion,
it was as if we were dreaming.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then our mouths were filled with laughter
and our tongues with joyful songs.
Then the nations said,
“The Lord has done spectacular things for them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has done spectacular things for us.
We are overjoyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Restore our fortunes, O Lord,
as you restore streams to dry riverbeds in the Negev.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who cry while they plant
will joyfully sing while they harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The person who goes out weeping, carrying his bag of seed,
will come home singing, carrying his bundles of grain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If the Lord does not build the house,
it is useless for the builders to work on it.
If the Lord does not protect a city,
it is useless for the guard to stay alert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is useless to work hard for the food you eat
by getting up early and going to bed late.
The Lord gives food to those he loves while they sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Children are an inheritance from the Lord.
They are a reward from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children born to a man when he is young
are like arrows in the hand of a warrior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man who has filled his quiver with them.
He will not be put to shame
when he speaks with his enemies in the city gate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are all who fear the Lord
and live his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will certainly eat what your own hands have provided.
Blessings to you!
May things go well for you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine inside your home.
Your children will be like young olive trees around your table.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is how the Lord will bless the person who fears him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord bless you from Zion
so that you may see Jerusalem prospering
all the days of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May you live to see your children’s children. 
Let there be peace in Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
“From the time I was young, people have attacked me …”
(Israel should repeat this.)
speaker: Narrator

text:
“From the time I was young, people have attacked me,
but they have never overpowered me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have plowed my back like farmers plow fields.
They made long slashes like furrows.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is righteous.
He has cut me loose
from the ropes that wicked people tied around me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put to shame all those who hate Zion.
Force them to retreat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make them be like grass on a roof,
like grass that dries up before it produces a stalk.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will never fill the barns of those who harvest
or the arms of those who gather bundles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who pass by will never say to them,
“May you be blessed by the Lord”
or “We bless you in the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, out of the depths I call to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, hear my voice.
Let your ears be open to my pleas for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, who would be able to stand
if you kept a record of sins?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But with you there is forgiveness
so that you can be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wait for the Lord, my soul waits,
and with hope I wait for his word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul waits for the Lord
more than those who watch for the morning,
more than those who watch for the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Israel, put your hope in the Lord,
because with the Lord there is mercy
and with him there is unlimited forgiveness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will rescue Israel from all its sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, my heart is not conceited.
My eyes do not look down on others.
I am not involved in things too big or too difficult for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead, I have kept my soul calm and quiet.
My soul is content as a weaned child is content in its mother’s arms.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel, put your hope in the Lord now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, remember David and all the hardships he endured.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember how he swore an oath to the Lord
and made this vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will not step inside my house,
speaker: Narrator

text: get into my bed, shut my eyes, or close my eyelids
speaker: Narrator

text:
until I find a place for the Lord,
a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now, we have heard about the ark of the promise being in Ephrathah.
We have found it in Jaar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let’s go to his dwelling place.
Let’s worship at his footstool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, arise, and come to your resting place
with the ark of your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Clothe your priests with righteousness.
Let your godly ones sing with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of your servant David,
do not reject your anointed one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord swore an oath to David.
This is a truth he will not take back:
“I will set one of your own descendants on your throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If your sons are faithful to my promise 
and my written instructions that I will teach them,
then their descendants will also sit on your throne forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has chosen Zion.
He wants it for his home.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“This will be my resting place forever.
Here I will sit enthroned because I want Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will certainly bless all that Zion needs.
I will satisfy its needy people with food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will clothe its priests with salvation.
Then its godly ones will sing joyfully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There I will make a horn sprout up for David.
I will prepare a lamp for my anointed one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
but the crown on my anointed one will shine.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
See how good and pleasant it is
when brothers and sisters live together in harmony!
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is like fine, scented oil on the head,
running down the beard—down Aaron’s beard—
running over the collar of his robes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is like dew on Mount Hermon,
dew which comes down on Zion’s mountains.
That is where the Lord promised
the blessing of eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all you servants of the Lord,
all who stand in the house of the Lord night after night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift your hands toward the holy place, and praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord, the maker of heaven and earth, bless you from Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hallelujah! 
Praise the name of the Lord.
Praise him, you servants of the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text:
who are standing in the house of the Lord,
in the courtyards of the house of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord because he is good.
Make music to praise his name because his name is beautiful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord chose Jacob to be his own
and chose Israel to be his own special treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know that the Lord is great,
that our Lord is greater than all the false gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord does whatever he wants in heaven or on earth,
on the seas or in all the depths of the oceans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who makes the clouds rise from the ends of the earth,
who makes lightning for the thunderstorms,
and who brings wind out of his storerooms.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who killed every firstborn male in Egypt.
He killed humans and animals alike.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent miraculous signs and amazing things into the heart of Egypt
against Pharaoh and all his officials.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the one who defeated many nations and killed mighty kings:
speaker: Narrator

text:
King Sihon of the Amorites,
King Og of Bashan,
and all the kingdoms in Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave their land as an inheritance,
an inheritance to his people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, your name endures forever.
O Lord, you will be remembered throughout every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will provide justice for his people
and have compassion on his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The idols of the nations are made of silver and gold.
They were made by human hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths, but they cannot speak.
They have eyes, but they cannot see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have ears, but they cannot hear.
They cannot breathe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who make idols end up like them.
So does everyone who trusts them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Descendants of Israel, praise the Lord.
Descendants of Aaron, praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Descendants of Levi, praise the Lord.
You people who fear the Lord, praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thank the Lord in Zion.
Thank the one who lives in Jerusalem. 
Hallelujah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord because he is good,
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the God of gods
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord of lords
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the only one who does miraculous things—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who made the heavens by his understanding—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who spread out the earth on the water—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the one who made the great lights—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
the sun to rule the day—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
the moon and stars to rule the night—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the one who killed the firstborn males in Egypt—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought Israel out from among them—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
with a mighty hand and a powerful arm—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to one who divided the Red Sea—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led Israel through the middle of it—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the one who led his people through the desert—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the one who defeated powerful kings—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He killed mighty kings—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
King Sihon of the Amorites—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
and King Og of Bashan—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave their land as an inheritance—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
as an inheritance for his servant Israel—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remembered us when we were humiliated—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He snatched us from the grasp of our enemies—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives food to every living creature—
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the God of heaven
because his mercy endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the rivers of Babylon, we sat down and cried
as we remembered Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: We hung our lyres on willow trees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It was there that those who had captured us demanded that we sing.
Those who guarded us wanted us to entertain them.
They said, “Sing a song from Zion for us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: How could we sing the Lord’s song in a foreign land?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I forget you, Jerusalem,
let my right hand forget how to play the lyre.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O Lord, remember the people of Edom.
Remember what they did the day Jerusalem was captured.
They said, “Tear it down! Tear it down to its foundation.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You destructive people of Babylon,
blessed is the one who pays you back
with the same treatment you gave us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the one who grabs your little children
and smashes them against a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you with all my heart.
I will make music to praise you in front of the false gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bow toward your holy temple.
I will give thanks to your name because of your mercy and truth.
You have made your name and your promise greater than everything.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I called, you answered me.
You made me bold by strengthening my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the kings of the earth will give thanks to you, O Lord,
because they have heard the promises you spoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will sing this about the ways of the Lord:
“The Lord’s honor is great!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though the Lord is high above, he sees humble people close up,
and he recognizes arrogant people from a distance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though I walk into the middle of trouble,
you guard my life against the anger of my enemies.
You stretch out your hand,
and your right hand saves me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will do everything for me.
O Lord, your mercy endures forever.
Do not let go of what your hands have made.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, you have examined me, and you know me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You alone know when I sit down and when I get up.
You read my thoughts from far away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You watch me when I travel and when I rest.
You are familiar with all my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even before there is a single word on my tongue,
you know all about it, Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are all around me—in front of me and in back of me.
You lay your hand on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Such knowledge is beyond my grasp.
It is so high I cannot reach it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where can I go to get away from your Spirit?
Where can I run to get away from you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I go up to heaven, you are there.
If I make my bed in hell, you are there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I climb upward on the rays of the morning sun
or land on the most distant shore of the sea where the sun sets,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even there your hand would guide me
and your right hand would hold on to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I say, “Let the darkness hide me
and let the light around me turn into night,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
even the darkness is not too dark for you.
Night is as bright as day.
Darkness and light are the same to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You alone created my inner being.
You knitted me together inside my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you
because I have been so amazingly and miraculously made.
Your works are miraculous, and my soul is fully aware of this.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My bones were not hidden from you
when I was being made in secret,
when I was being skillfully woven in an underground workshop.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your eyes saw me when I was still an unborn child.
Every day of my life was recorded in your book
before one of them had taken place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How precious are your thoughts concerning me, O God!
How vast in number they are!
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I try to count them,
there would be more of them than there are grains of sand.
When I wake up, I am still with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wish that you would kill wicked people, O God,
and that bloodthirsty people would leave me alone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They say wicked things about you.
Your enemies misuse your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shouldn’t I hate those who hate you, O Lord?
Shouldn’t I be disgusted with those who attack you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate them with all my heart.
They have become my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Examine me, O God, and know my mind.
Test me, and know my thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See whether I am on an evil path.
Then lead me on the everlasting path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me from evil people, O Lord.
Keep me safe from violent people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They plan evil things in their hearts.
They start fights every day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They make their tongues as sharp as a snake’s fang.
Their lips hide the venom of poisonous snakes. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Protect me from the hands of wicked people, O Lord.
Keep me safe from violent people.
They try to trip me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arrogant people have laid a trap for me.
They have spread out a net with ropes.
They have set traps for me along the road. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said to the Lord, “You are my God.”
O Lord, open your ears to hear my plea for pity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord Almighty, the strong one who saves me,
you have covered my head in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, do not give wicked people what they want.
Do not let their evil plans succeed,
or they will become arrogant. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heads of those who surround me
be covered with their own threats.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let burning coals fall on them.
Let them be thrown into a pit, never to rise again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let slanderers prosper on earth.
Let evil hunt down violent people with one blow after another.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know that the Lord will defend the rights of those who are oppressed
and the cause of those who are needy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, righteous people will give thanks to your name.
Decent people will live in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I cry out to you, “Come quickly.”
Open your ears to me when I cry out to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my prayer be accepted
as sweet-smelling incense in your presence.
Let the lifting up of my hands in prayer be accepted
as an evening sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, set a guard at my mouth.
Keep watch over the door of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let me be persuaded to do anything evil
or to become involved with wickedness,
with people who are troublemakers.
Do not let me taste their delicacies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A righteous person may strike me or correct me out of kindness.
It is like lotion for my head.
My head will not refuse it,
because my prayer is directed against evil deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When their judges are thrown off a cliff,
they will listen to what I have to say.
It will sound pleasant to them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As someone plows and breaks up the ground,
so our bones will be planted at the mouth of the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes look to you, Lord Almighty.
I have taken refuge in you.
Do not leave me defenseless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me away from the trap they set for me
and from the traps set by troublemakers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let wicked people fall into their own nets,
while I escape unharmed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Loudly, I cry to the Lord.
Loudly, I plead with the Lord for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pour out my complaints in his presence
and tell him my troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I begin to lose hope,
you already know what I am experiencing. 
My enemies have hidden a trap for me on the path where I walk.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look to my right and see that no one notices me.
Escape is impossible for me.
No one cares about me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I call out to you, O Lord.
I say, “You are my refuge,
my own inheritance in this world of the living.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pay attention to my cry for help
because I am very weak.
Rescue me from those who pursue me
because they are too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Release my soul from prison
so that I may give thanks to your name.
Righteous people will surround me
because you are good to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, listen to my prayer.
Open your ears to hear my urgent requests.
Answer me because you are faithful and righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not take me to court for judgment,
because there is no one alive
who is righteous in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The enemy has pursued me.
He has ground my life into the dirt.
He has made me live in dark places
like those who have died long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is why I begin to lose hope
and my heart is in a state of shock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remember the days long ago.
I reflect on all that you have done.
I carefully consider what your hands have made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I stretch out my hands to you in prayer.
Like parched land, my soul thirsts for you. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Answer me quickly, O Lord.
My spirit is worn out.
Do not hide your face from me,
or I will be like those who go into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me hear about your mercy in the morning,
because I trust you.
Let me know the way that I should go,
because I long for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me from my enemies, O Lord.
I come to you for protection.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me to do your will, because you are my God.
May your good Spirit lead me on level ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, keep me alive for the sake of your name.
Because you are righteous, lead me out of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In keeping with your mercy, wipe out my enemies
and destroy all who torment me,
because I am your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thank the Lord, my rock,
who trained my hands to fight
and my fingers to do battle,
speaker: Narrator

text:
my merciful one, my fortress,
my stronghold, and my savior,
my shield, the one in whom I take refuge,
and the one who brings people under my authority.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, what are humans that you should care about them?
What are mere mortals that you should think about them?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Humans are like a breath of air.
Their life span is like a fleeting shadow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, bend your heaven low, and come down.
Touch the mountains, and they will smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hurl bolts of lightning, and scatter them.
Shoot your arrows, and throw them into confusion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Stretch out your hands from above.
Snatch me, and rescue me from raging waters
and from foreigners’ hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their mouths speak lies.
Their right hands take false pledges.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, I will sing a new song to you.
I will sing a psalm to you on a ten-stringed harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are the one who gives victory to kings.
You are the one who snatches your servant David
away from a deadly sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Snatch me, and rescue me from foreigners’ hands.
Their mouths speak lies.
Their right hands take false pledges.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May our sons be like full-grown, young plants.
May our daughters be like stately columns
that adorn the corners of a palace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May our barns be filled with all kinds of crops.
May our sheep give birth to thousands of lambs,
tens of thousands in our fields.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May our cattle have many calves.
May no one break in, and may no one be dragged out.
May there be no cries of distress in our streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are the people who have these blessings!
Blessed are the people whose God is the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will highly praise you, my God, the king.
I will bless your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bless you every day.
I will praise your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is great, and he should be highly praised.
His greatness is unsearchable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One generation will praise your deeds to the next.
Each generation will talk about your mighty acts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will think about the glorious honor of your majesty
and the miraculous things you have done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
People will talk about the power of your terrifying deeds,
and I will tell about your greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will announce what they remember of your great goodness,
and they will joyfully sing about your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is merciful, compassionate, patient,
and always ready to forgive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is good to everyone
and has compassion for everything that he has made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everything that you have made will give thanks to you, O Lord,
and your faithful ones will praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone will talk about the glory of your kingdom
and will tell the descendants of Adam about your might
speaker: Narrator

text:
in order to make known your mighty deeds
and the glorious honor of your kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom.
Your empire endures throughout every generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord supports everyone who falls.
He straightens the backs of those who are bent over.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of all creatures look to you,
and you give them their food at the proper time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You open your hand,
and you satisfy the desire of every living thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is fair in all his ways
and faithful in everything he does.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is near to everyone who prays to him,
to every faithful person who prays to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He fills the needs of those who fear him.
He hears their cries for help and saves them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord protects everyone who loves him,
but he will destroy all wicked people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord,
and all living creatures will praise his holy name
forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hallelujah! 
Praise the Lord, my soul!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I want to praise the Lord throughout my life.
I want to make music to praise my God as long as I live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not trust influential people,
mortals who cannot help you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they breathe their last breath, they return to the ground.
On that day their plans come to an end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those who receive help from the God of Jacob.
Their hope rests on the Lord their God,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who made heaven, earth,
the sea, and everything in them.
The Lord remains faithful forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brings about justice for those who are oppressed.
He gives food to those who are hungry.
The Lord sets prisoners free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord gives sight to blind people.
The Lord straightens the backs of those who are bent over.
The Lord loves righteous people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord protects foreigners.
The Lord gives relief to orphans and widows.
But he keeps wicked people from reaching their goal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord rules as king forever.
Zion, your God rules throughout every generation. 
Hallelujah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hallelujah! 
It is good to sing psalms to our God.
It is pleasant to sing his praise beautifully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is the builder of Jerusalem.
He is the one who gathers the outcasts of Israel together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the healer of the brokenhearted.
He is the one who bandages their wounds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He determines the number of stars.
He gives each one a name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our Lord is great, and his power is great.
There is no limit to his understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord gives relief to those who are oppressed.
He brings wicked people down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord a song of thanksgiving.
Make music to our God with a lyre.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He covers the sky with clouds.
He provides rain for the ground.
He makes grass grow on the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who gives food to animals
and to young ravens when they call out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He finds no joy in strong horses,
nor is he pleased by brave soldiers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is pleased with those who fear him,
with those who wait with hope for his mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, Jerusalem!
Praise your God, Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes the bars across your gates strong.
He blesses the children within you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who brings peace to your borders
and satisfies your hunger with the finest wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who sends his promise throughout the earth.
His word travels with great speed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who sends snow like wool
and scatters frost like ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the one who throws his hailstones like breadcrumbs.
Who can withstand his chilling blast?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends out his word and melts his hailstones.
He makes wind blow and water flow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He speaks his word to Jacob,
his laws and judicial decisions to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has done nothing like this for any other nation.
The other nations do not know the decisions he has handed down. 
Hallelujah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hallelujah! 
Praise the Lord from the heavens.
Praise him in the heights above.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, all his angels.
Praise him, his entire heavenly army.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, sun and moon.
Praise him, all shining stars.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, you highest heaven
and the water above the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise the name of the Lord
because they were created by his command.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He set them in their places forever and ever.
He made it a law that no one can break.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord from the earth.
Praise him, large sea creatures and all the ocean depths,
speaker: Narrator

text:
lightning and hail,
snow and fog,
strong winds that obey his commands,
speaker: Narrator

text:
mountains and all hills,
fruit trees and all cedar trees,
speaker: Narrator

text:
wild animals and all domestic animals,
crawling animals and birds,
speaker: Narrator

text:
kings of the earth and all its people,
officials and all judges on the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
young men and women,
old and young together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise the name of the Lord
because his name is high above all others.
His glory is above heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has given his people a strong leader,
someone praiseworthy for his faithful ones,
for the people of Israel, the people who are close to him. 
Hallelujah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hallelujah! 
Sing a new song to the Lord.
Sing his praise in the assembly of godly people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Israel find joy in their creator.
Let the people of Zion rejoice over their king.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise his name with dancing.
Let them make music to him with tambourines and lyres,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because the Lord takes pleasure in his people.
He crowns those who are oppressed with victory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let godly people triumph in glory.
Let them sing for joy on their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the high praises of God be in their throats
and two-edged swords in their hands
speaker: Narrator

text:
to take vengeance on the nations,
to punish the people of the world,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to put their kings in chains
and their leaders in iron shackles,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to carry out the judgment that is written against them.
This is an honor that belongs to all his godly ones. 
Hallelujah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hallelujah! 
Praise God in his holy place.
Praise him in his mighty heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him for his mighty acts.
Praise him for his immense greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with sounds from horns.
Praise him with harps and lyres.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with tambourines and dancing.
Praise him with stringed instruments and flutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with loud cymbals.
Praise him with crashing cymbals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let everything that breathes praise the Lord! 
Hallelujah!
speaker: Narrator
